reviews.review:
I originally had Vandenbosch as my professor for this course, but she ultimately fell ill and was replaced by Nadler.

Despite the other reviews, I enjoyed having Nadler as my professor. She stuck very close to the text (she lectured by reading her notes from the text itself) and her exams were often open note. She also made lectures very interesting and open to discussion. She has a sarcastic sense of humor, but she never means to insult anybody. She actually praises people in the course that had speech anxiety because she notices how hard they work to overcome it.

That being said, I had an extensive theatrical and speaking background and received B's on most of my presentations. She does grade semi-harshly. However, she left extensive notes on our grades on ELMS (BIG PLUS--she sticks to ELMS quite closely, very convenient). She also replies to emails very quickly, so it's easy to get in touch with her.

Definitely socialize with her before and after class. She's a sweet woman! It will also get you on her good side. I missed probably close to 10 classes and the entire second exam, but she bumped my grade up from a C+ to a B- after an email asking her for help. She understands how important grades look on a transcript and will sympathize.

Prof. Nadler generally was a decent grader and did seem to take into account people's natural skill level entering the course, which was fair and helpful. 

She did however have a tendency to nitpick on written assignments. She also definitely gave off a passive aggressive personality at times.

That being said, she was helpful when you asked her things before and after class. 

She was notably open with her progressive political beliefs, which I suppose is to be expected on a college campus, and knowing this will help you when picking a speech topic. Talking about microaggressions will go over a lot better than talking about the perils of affirmative action.

DO NOT TAKE PAULA NADLER! I know this looks like a long review but PLEASE READ AND DO NOT TAKE THIS LIGHTLY.

I should have taken my roommate's advice more seriously: He had Nadler when she began teaching 107 sections last Spring semester, and according to my roommate, she TOLD his class, "I WAS ASSIGNED TO BEGIN TEACHING COMM 107 TO LOWER THE OVERALL GPA FOR THIS COURSE." I could not believe him at first, but as it turns out, he (and she) were right. There are 2 people in my class who have A- 's and one who has an A. The rest of the students' grades range from B to F. That just should not happen in an INTRODUCTORY LEVEL, GENERAL EDUCATION COURSE. In speaking with friends who took the same course this semester, I have heard that almost everyone in every class has an A or a B. 

As said from previous reviewers, she plays favorites LIKE YOU WOULD NOT BELIEVE. I actually thought I was one of her favorites, but that seemed to change about midway through the semester as I started getting more and more points taken off of my assignments and speeches. Your skills are supposed to improve in this class, not degrade! It did not help having her at 8am three days each week, as she marked me off for coming in only 5 minutes late...and did not care about student who slept in. She does give you 3 free absences as per dept standards, but as it was my only 8am class, these 3 freebies evaporated all too quickly for me--and every class you miss after the first 3 basically removes from a half to a whole PERCENT off of your grade. Course is comprised of 200 points, and the participation grade is like 15 points or something like that. Every bit you miss will hurt you. NADLER LIKE TO NIT PICK ON EVERYTHING, BE AWARE.  

She is a terrible lecturer, and will start the year by going through the chapter assigned for that day's reading  and then will progressively cover less and less information than is on the exams. I received a 100, an 88, and a 55 on Exams 1, 2, and 3, respectively. For the main presentations, I received a 4.5/5, a 25/30, a 24/30, and then a 32/41 on the final. Did I become a worse student? I really doubt that.... given that I am in the Engineering school and got straight A's in all my other classes, and I also gave a most memorable speech at my High School graduation. 

If you think you are a good public speaker, you are probably right. Don't let this woman's class tell you otherwise. Take anyone else and you should get a solid A just by showing up and trying your best. BUT NOT HERE. DROP IF POSSIBLE. Another section will likely open up. If you absolutely cannot drop her, HEED MY WARNINGS AND GOOD LUCK.

This professor does play favorites (as the reviewer below mentioned) with athletes. She takes her personal feelings into the classroom, she also is plain mean to individual students. Try not to take this professor. She made everyone dread coming to class everyday. She sees everything as a challenge and does not like students who think/have ideas.

Nadler is disrespectful to students. She cops an attitude when people ask questions, rolls her eyes, and sighs at the class. One student said to me "I am scared to ask questions anymore in class". For a COMM107 teacher, I would hope she would know the impact of her verbal and nonverbal communication. She laughed at a students hair one day. She is not engaging at all. We have to use power points, and hand gestures, and move around during our speeches, but when she lectures for the class she just sits in a chair at the front, sometimes eating food. Are we supposed to do what she does? Or do what she tells us to do? She does not like to be challenged. She refused to repeat a vocabulary word for a student. I do not respect her as a teacher and do not think she should be allowed to teach an 100 level COMM class.

Terrible professor, she definitely plays favorites among the athletes. She grades rather harshly on the group presentations. Her review sessions are not helpful, answering everything with "We discussed it in class." Does not like to be challenged.

She's nice and her class is easy going but her grading and tests are so hard.
All she does in class is sit there and talk, and the stuff she's talkign about seems so easy and straight forward but them the tests are all fill in the blank and True/false and they ask you about the most random details in text book like "how many avg hours do kids watch tv in the us" and the word bank has like 7 different numbers so you just have to guess. 
as far as grading goes every times I turned in a paper to her it came back to me covered in red marks with her "corrections" but really most of the time i hadn't done anything wrong, she just preferred things I said to be stated in her own style which really annoyed me.
Best teacher. So kind, yet also a fair grader. Oddly felt at home in her classroom.

Gerry Strumpf is a seriously adorable southern woman that can be put off track easily and tells story after story in class. We hardly took notes, and I never opened the book. That being said, she is a strangely hard grader for her teaching style. The class was laid back and fun, and I genuinely enjoyed being in class. It is an easy A if you take your speeches seriously (which I didn't at first). She is such a kind woman and she made COMM107 bearable. I would definitely recommend her.

I'm kind of embarassed that I got an A minus at the end of this class because it was seriously easy, although she's a surprisingly tough grader. But she's pretty lenient and caring and nice person. If you're looking for an A in comm, take her. If you're looking to learn about public speaking, take her. If you're looking to skip class, don't take her she takes it seriously(totally the reason why I got the minus).
Jade Olson is awesome and makes comm107 great. def take this class with her if you have the chance.

I don't understand the other review at all...Ms. Madden was a great teacher! She really was interested in making the class enjoyable to her students. She asked her students about their preferences on exams and played really helpful videos that were informative and fun. You'll probably end up having a B in this class; you'll only get an A if you actually give this class your time which is least likely. But she was still an awesome respectable teacher who cared about her students.

I don't know why she has so many bad reviews . . . 

Comm is mostly common sense, mixed in with a few new terms. 

Deepa is not a harsh grader by any means. She actually grades pretty leniently. It's not an guaranteed 100% on every assignment, but it's still an A or B as long as you follow the directions. She's nice and she tries to make her lectures as interesting as possible.

That being said, her exams are mostly lecture based. Pay some attention in class and most importantly to the Powerpoints and definitions.

Her exams are a little bit more detailed which can throw you off. Learn to memorize everything. Literally.

Overall, a relatively easy enough A with some work involved.
guy below me said it all.  grades extremely harsh in attempt to make this useless subject important.  deducts points for no reason and is clueless to the actual topic she is teaching.

I came into this class worried about having Deepa because of the review below, but I soon found out it wasn't accurate at all. She has a slight accent which doesn't interfere with the lecture  and she tries to make lectures as interesting as possible (comm107 is a boring class). Her grading is harder than the other comm professors, but if you follow the in depth rubrics she hands out you can easily pull an A or B on every assignment.

Deepa is a power tripping ***** who loves to hear herself speak poor english for 90 minutes straight. She takes the class and grading way too seriously. Too bad this won't make her any more successful in life. This other review can NOT have come from a student.

I love Deepa!  She is just so nice, welcoming, and engaging.  She may grade harder than other COMM107 teachers but that's only because she really wants everybody's communication skills to improve.  She is a wonderful teacher!
The class was pretty easy overall, not much work just 5 speeches and quizzes are straight from the reading. Overall nice teacher very relaxed and grades pretty easily.
One of the best teachers I have ever had period. Very easy A and the most fun you will have in a class at UMD. Take his class, you won't regret it

Rodney Schwartz is hella annoying. He won’t give out A’s in COMM107, which is ridiculous, it should be an easy A. He hates technology and is incompetent at it, so there is always issues with ELMS and he doesn’t respond to emails. He gets off topic and then blames the students for the for the distraction. The majority of the class is him going over the material from the last class and talking about random shit, so you’ll only learn new material for about 5 minutes out of the entire class. So if you want a B in a class that you should earn an A in, learn barley anything, and listen to a guy who thinks he’s the shit, I’d highly recommend Prof. Schwartz.

So the professor's name is actually rodney schwartz, but i digress. DO NOT TAKE HIM FOR COMM. There are so many better teachers. He refuses to put anything on elms or tell you what your grades are. He is so unreasonable and does not teach at all. His tests are based completely on the  book, but he rarely goes over the content it in class. And when he does, it takes him so long to go over a simple concept so its no help. And on top of that he is super petty when it comes to presentations and will take points off just because he doesn't agree with you. Literally comm is so he easy, but he makes it 10x harder just because he is so old  fashion and refuses to get with technology and the times. My class was literally a month behind all the other sections so he had to drop half the assignments. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!

Oh, Rodney. Anti-technology, ELMS becomes useless, and you don't ever know your grade. For a communications professor he is a poor communicator as well. You don't learn much, but if you embrace the stupidity of the class you will do fine. Workload is very small and doesn't require much time or effort, but don't expect to be inspired to learn more about communications or anything. Probably better to find a different professor if you don't want a slow-paced class you learn next to nothing in.

This review is also for Rodney Schwartz, the Comm "Professor". This guy (I will abstain from calling him professor, as that entails he actually educates students) was the worst person I've ever had for ANY class at Maryland. Not only was he completely incompetent at teaching the subject, his grades were vastly lower than every other comm class. First, onto his teaching skills. He has none. Seriously, he doesn't teach. More than half of our class was going over what we did last class, then the rest of it was him blabbering on about absolutely nothing. Well, if he sucks at teaching, at least he may give you a good grade right? Guess again. In a class full of 17 people, NO ONE GOT AN A. IN COMM107. 5 people around me got an 82 on one of the speeches, despite all varying in how well they actually did. Rodney Schwartz is the epitome of an awful "professor" at the University of Maryland, and you should avoid him unless you want to get a high C in COMM107.

Schwartz is a special type of person. He is the type of person that makes you so infuriated and frustrated at his teaching style, that the frustrations leak into other parts of your life. Every day after class (before I withdrew from it, because I could not take any more of his shit) I would find that I was still angry hours after I left the class. 
The problems reached a head when I asked in class whether a certain book would count as a good source for the first speech. He said no, without explanation, so I asked again. This time he asked me if I was joking, and asked to speak with me after class. He chewed me out for being disruptive in class, and I told him that I had *NO* idea what he was talking about. I could tell that something was off about him at that point. 
And then the issues kept coming. Because he flat out REFUSES to use technology and post meeting times/places online, I didn't know that class was in the library one day, and he took away my participation points for the day. It's little things like that that added up, and caused me to withdraw from the class. Yes, I withdrew from the class, and got a big fat W on my transcript because of him. It was better than going through another day with him standing in the front of the class telling jokes, having no direction as a teacher.
Please take this as a warning. Stay away from Rodney Schwartz. He could quite possibly be the devil reincarnated, and his sole job on this earth is to drag students down to the depths of his education-less hell. Take my unfortunate story, and the other reviews, as proof that you do not want to have this man standing in front of you during class.

Shittiest teacher ever.
Knows next to nothing about communication, hates everything about technology, and will give everyone a terrible grade regardless of the quality of work.  Highest grades in the class barely crossed the 90% mark.

Workload is fairly light, until the last few weeks where he frantically assigns the interview and persuasive and group speech to be due and presented within a week of each other.

Work your ass off all semester, endlessly rehearsing your speeches, and dear old Rodney will reward you with a nice fat B.

Avoid this teacher at all costs.
Top tier, always go for him if you can get him.

Stay as far away from her as possible! Her mental state is volatile at best; anger mgt issues; expects everyone to agree with her man-hating warped views that she tells inappropriately. When classes were delayed bc of weather, a commuter kid quietly walked in about 5 min late and sat silently in the back of the room. When Meridith got mad when no one volunteered to read their report (prob bc she skewers them), this kid quietly raised his hand. She flipped out at him bc he "dared to think" he would be called on when he was already given a 0 for the assignment bc he "disrupted" class by walking in late. How about: glad you made it ... Sorry to hear your car was hit on the way in. Hope you're ok.
Dr. Swift is a good professor, pretty chill as a person. Very clear in communicating things, responsive to student concerns. He is a tough grader though...
Easy fun and entertaining. Take him if you want crazy in your life.
Professor Smithson is awesome. She brings a unique enthusiasm to every class period. She goes out of her way to make the course as fun as possible. You won't regret taking her.
Dr. Gordon is a tough grader but is a lot of fun. She's crazy but it keeps the class interesting.
incredibly fun teacher. loving it so far. very chill and helpful and willing to talk to you if anything comes up.
LOVE her! SO enthusiastic and interesting and happy to help with anything. She is super accessible
Such an amazing teacher! Actually taught the material on the syllabus, and was an easy grader. Had an amazing semester! 10/10 recommends

If you're a natural public speaker, this class is an easy A. Otherwise, Gerry does a great job of preparing you for the speeches you will give. A bunch of online quizzes (open book), no exams, a couple speeches, and one group project. Lectures require participation. Not the right teacher for quiet students... Highly recommend!!

I feel like you can't help but love Gerry's class. Yeah, she may be a bit crazy, but she is warm, caring, and clearly passionate about her subject. Although she grades a bit tougher that one would expect, she is more than willing to work with you to improve. Take this class if you want an entertaining hour fifteen every other day. Highly recommend.
Perfect kind of teacher for Comm. Kind, helpful, organized, and sets reasonable expectations for her students.
She is so wonderful! Definitely take her for COMM107 if you can. Goes over content well and definitely prepares you for all the speeches :)
Good professor, but not very easy. You will improve as a speaker if you take him, but your GPA might take a small knock.
Wackiest dude I've ever met. He has a great teaching style, and vividly exemplifies the concepts. Absolutely magnificent.
Great teacher, take her! Enjoyed the class lots.
Really nice professor!
Awesome teacher.
Great professor but grades way too hard compared to other 107 professors, definitely take someone else if you can.
Very difficult grader, especially for COMM107, not a bad guy, teaches well, but avoid for COMM107, he’s just not worth it for such an entry level course.

Ms. Chatham is very kind and friendly. She sets clear and reasonable expectations on homework and on in-class speaking assignments, and is a lenient grader. Even if you are fairly inexperienced with public speaking, trying your best will provide you an A in the class.
really sweet, what a gangster. recommend 10/10
Not bad. Teaches the class well, pretty fair grader.
A great professor. Highly recommend anyone to take it with him. Super chill, fun and easy going. Class isn’t too difficult
Don't take Jefferson for this course. Her unclear directions (that were sometimes very contradictory) made an easy gen-ed into something that I dreaded going to every day.

Dr. Nadler is probably one of the worst teachers I have ever had. All of the other negative reviews about her are very accurate. She is completely closed off to any idea that isn't her own. She is a very harsh grader and plays favorites. Students who she likes will get very high grades on all their speeches, even if they clearly have an off day. Students who she does not like will never be able to get the same scores, no matter how skilled they are at public speaking and how hard they try. She is condescending and mean. She will take an opportunity to embarrass students in class and make them feel stupid when they try and answer her questions. She is very short tempered. If you pick a speech topic that she doesn't agree with, you can expect a bad grade. Any time you ask ANY question she will treat you like you are stupid and wasting her time. I could go on and on about her, but long story short, avoid her at all costs if you can.

Excellent comm107 professor. Fair grader and very helpful. I definitely did get better at public speaking and he gave good advice. He'll help you work through your speech at office hours if you go to them. Made a painful class much more bearable
Great Comm professor, easy grader, very understanding and friendly. He's easy to talk to and is usually available easily.
Tough grader. Fun but also has no filter, and can come off very rude sometimes.
Nice teacher but low key felt as if it was harder than other comm classes

I admired Aya so much throughout this semester. She is currently a grad student, with so much knowledge about the world! I loved listening to her explain her own experiences with research and communication. She forced me to grow my oral communication skills, which I am forever thankful for. Her class included 5 speeches and I have heard that other classes had less speeches. However, she always gives very constructive feedback and wants you to do well. If you are willing to put in moderate effort, Aya will notice and grade accordingly! The class may seem stressful, but it will help develop your oral communication skills.  I definitely recommend her for the oral communication credit :)

Williams is literally amazing—he’s the most chill and understanding professor ever. He understands that we’re busy college students, and because of that, he doesn’t want COMM to be our #1 worry come midterms or finals season. 
I’ve heard that other COMM profs tend to give out A’s like there’s no tomorrow, but if you actually want to improve your public speaking skills, you want Williams as your prof because he’s not too critical, but always offers useful suggestions and comments on your presentations and progress within the course.
I’m not a strong public speaker myself, but having Williams as my COMM107 instructor really helped me grow confident in my abilities.
One of the most caring and just all around awesome professors I had this semester. Usually teaches COMM in the fall. Definitely recommend him if he’s available!

Generally good, but grades a little harshly. He grades specifically to the rubric, so read that ahead of time. He'll still probably find something to take a point or two off of :/ Make sure you pay attention to due dates because they're inconsistent (sometimes due before class sometimes at 11.59 pm). 
I guess one pro is that he provides a lot of specific feedback for each of the assignments so that you know what to improve, but you won't get an easy A with this dude.

I took this class online and it was super easy. We had some reading quizzes and a few speeches. The speeches were recorded and turned in via video. We had an introductory speech, an information speech, a revised informational speech, a persuasive speech, and a special occasion speech. The final was another speech about what we learned and improved on throughout the class. The professor was very understanding and during the winter semester when I went on vacation and one of my hotels had bad wifi he let me turn in my assignment a day late without any points taken off. 

Overall hes a very nice guy and I highly recommend anyone who is struggling with public speaking to take the online version if you are uncomfortable with the classroom version

Dr. Bruner is one of the easiest going teachers. She made the lectures interesting, interactive, and allowed students to understand the material. There are online quizzes, but as long as you do the reading, the quizzes are easy. Very light grader when giving speeches.

You're going to love Fielding! He understands that most students are not COMM majors, but he still makes sure everyone gets something from the class. He is incredibly understanding and caring. I HIGHLY recommend taking his class.

She grades rather harshly and is extremely picky about pedantic stuff.  Her class also has attendance/participation points each day. On speech days she gives you vocal feedback in front of the entire class which can be extremely humiliating.  Most of her criticism is valid but do you really want to let your GPA suffer because of her.

I did not want to take COMM. She understood most people were there because they had to be and did a good job teaching to that.  The class was interesting and not too difficult even if you arent interested in the material
amazing person. but sometimes forgetful/too busy with her other work. But if you talk to her during class she can always help

This prof is the COOLEST you could ever have. He is super young and cool. He also understands the stress students have over public speaking and makes the environment super lowkey for students to thrive and feel comfortable speaking. If you show up and do your speeches expect a very high grade. 100% pick Aaron if given the chance.

Such an amazing personable guy, only complaint is he gave out different grades for a group assignment that we worked on evenly but aside from that he ensures that your grade is good and makes the class super fun. I recommend taking him
Ok professor. Not my favorite but not my least favorite, so this professor isn’t bad to have
Super sweet lady! Definitely cares about all her students, and is a very flexible and understanding person. She is not a hard grader at all, I would definitely take her again.

If you sign up for COMM107 and end up with her, I highly suggest dropping this course within the add/drop period and re-enrolling with a different professor. She projects herself as someone who wants to help her students and teach them how to be great communicators, but within two weeks into the course she reveals her true colors. She is an arrogant, unhelpful, and sometimes even offensive instructor. First of all, she gives very unclear instructions on her assignments and if you email her asking for a clarification, she won't even respond half of the time, giving the vague answer  of "you should read the syllabus" (even when the syllabus does not mention anything relevant). And on top of these unclear instructions, she still grades very harshly and hardly even mentions what you did wrong. If you ask her why something was graded the way it was, you will be lucky to get a proper response. She acts as if she is above everyone in the room, as if she has this aura where everyone will look up to her. And if she is running short on time, it doesn't matter if you worked your ass off on an assignment, or if you spent 3 seconds on it, you'll get the same grade. And despite the fact that we are in 2020, she has still makes so many racially insensitive comments in class which she probably thinks are okay just because she herself is a minority too.  Some of you who are reading this will probably think that this review is biased, but I am not the only one who has felt this way about her. I don't know why there aren't more reviews for her on PlanetTerp, but if you type in "Victoria Mends-Cole" into RateMyProfessor you will see a much more accurate depiction of who this teacher really is. To summarize this, if you want to avoid trouble your freshman year, just don't take this class

Great professor! Really enjoyed her class, and she made the speeches low-pressure and chill. The assignments were all good and they weren't difficult. She's a really nice person too and it was easy to talk to her, in class and out. Learned a lot from her and had a great time in her class!
Awesome prof. She's super entertaining and awesome.
Amazing instructor. Cares about students. You need to put a bit effort in class to get grades but otherwise it's excellent

I love Gerry's class so much! She is trying really hard to make the online format work for everyone and it is the most enjoyable of all of my classes. Class is relaxed and fun but my public speaking has definitely improved. Make sure you show up to class, pay attention (she can tell!), and do the quizzes (reasonable ones) from the textbook, and you'll do well. She is my favorite professor and I highly recommend taking her for COMM107. I even plan on taking UNIV362 just because she is teaching it.
Pretty good lecturer but tough grader
Great professor. Very understanding and actually makes the class useful
Dr. Jefferson is an excellent professor! I was nervous about taking a public speaking course, but she is great at teaching ways to develop your skills and confidence.

Kalin is one of the sweetest and friendliest instructors I have ever had. It’s very easy to talk to her because she is very relatable and makes a point of letting students know they are not alone in their struggles, saying she struggles with similar things too (i.e. deadlines, group work, etc.). She is very understanding and accommodating as long as you communicate with her. That’s not to say that she’s a pushover; she usually won’t extent deadlines because it is a college course, but she is super understanding, and even if you don’t think anything will change if you come to her with a problem in her class regarding deadlines, I think it’s still really important to be in communication with her because her knowing your situation is a big way she can help you and just be aware of where you are. And if something in her class isn’t working well for you, chances are she’d be happy to help you figure out another way to approach it. She is always offering to meet individually with students who are struggling in any way, and she is happy to take the time to come up with individualized plans for her students that need it so they can succeed best. I don’t know a lot of people in my class personally, but the environment she creates is very comfortable, and I feel safe speaking my mind without being judged because she creates a very friendly and accepting environment. I feel comfortable striking up a conversation with pretty much anyone in my class just because of how relaxed and friendly the environment is. Her lectures are interesting and easy to understand. There are a lot of presentations we have to do, but Kalin does everything she can to help students have end products they are content with. She provides students with a lot of resources and places emphasis on preparation. I feel very equipped with resources and knowledge every time I start an assignment, its really just a matter of putting that knowledge into action. Even for a Gen Ed, I found the class to be really interesting. In her lectures, she’ll also share a lot of short videos that help illustrate a concept she’s teaching. The videos are one of my favorite parts about lectures because they’re really interesting and entertaining, yet also educational. Overall, she is a very friendly and understanding professor. Every student in her class is accepted and celebrated. It really is a fun class.
Great guy. Straightforward class. Syllabus schedule is detailed so you should never forget about some minor assignment.
Awesome professor, really cares about her students!
Very good teacher! Does a good job engaging students in the virtual format of the class!
Taylor is great. Grades leniently, has clear expectations on assignments. If you do your work at all, easy A.

She’s a really chill professor who’s really kind and understanding of her students especially with the stress we feel with the pandemic. Speeches are not graded harshly just put in some effort. Quizzes are not hard if u read the textbook

Aaron is the NICEST guy ever! He is incredibly understanding and is willing to work with you to make sure you succeed in this class. The class is not hard and he does an amazing job at trying to make this class as easy as possible while also making sure you are learning the material. Especially with virtual learning, this man has been awesome at creating a stress-free experience. I felt super comfortable in this class and also feel like I learned a lot about public speaking. He truly knows his stuff and is just passionate about public speaking and communication, so please take this class with Aaron Swanlek if you get the chance, I promise you will not regret it.
One of my favorite professors this semester, she is such a sweet professor. She is extremely accommodating and great to work with. She doesn't give a ton of homework only 2 weekly assignments.

John was a really nice guy who made COMM107 super easy.  All our presentations were recorded so we could do as many takes as we liked, but you don't really need to since he is an incredibly lenient grader. Every other assignment is essentially just completion points, except for the quizzes. They quizzes were directly based off the textbook, and you could easily find the answers in it so reading isn't really necessary. There is a group presentation towards the end of the semester which was kind of annoying to organize with everyone. The final was just a special occasion presentation, which had basically no structure so you could do whatever.

He is very nice and genuinely cares about his students. The assignments are pretty chill because you get top pick your own topic for each type of speech/presentation. Lectures are very engaging and he doesn't give busy work. A lot of group work is probably the only negative, but that's probably the case in any COMM107 class because the classes are small (~30 ppl in mine).

She seriously is one of the best professors you could have for this course and at UMD. She is very understanding of mental health and ensures that you are doing fine and the course load is very manageable. She is also very flexible with submitting assignments, and accommodated the class to fit the online method. Her grading is very relaxed, and as long as you put a decent effort, you will be guaranteed at least a 95%.  There is a textbook and weekly quizzes but the quizzes are open note and I consistently got 9 and 10s out of 10 without ever reading the textbook. Seriously, take this course with this professor.

I advise not taking COMM107 with her. For one, she would never give written feedback (you had to attend her office hours to find out why you got a certain grade, even though this course was taught online), even after making us wait for several weeks to a month to get a grade on any given assignment. She would also make insensitive comments in class that would make students feel uncomfortable, and often did not respond to questions sent through email. I'll give her some credit for being flexible on deadlines, and I think that some criticism of her is overblown, but I still would not recommend taking this course with her.

I took this course in Fall 2019

Pros:
+ She's extremely sweet and understanding and will go out of her way to make sure you understand content.
+ Easy A
Picky grader but otherwise good teacher and adapted to online stuff pretty well. Definitely still an easy gen ed course with him
Great professor. Was always available if you needed help and was always very encouraging and accomodating.

Professor Swanlek, if you're reading this, YOU ARE AMAZING. I took this class because it was required, however I was excited to go to class because of him. He was a great, understanding teacher who knew what he was talking about and kept the class entertained with his occasional jokes and great personality. If you decide to take COMM107, go with Swanlek.

I cannot stress how incredible Professor Swanlek is. He is truly such an amazing professor. First off, he knows what he's doing and does so well with helping out students to any capacity that they need. Even with the virtual format and lack of engagement from students, he made class so fun and interesting. He's always cracking jokes and being himself which makes learning and staying engaged so much easier. He's seriously the coolest guy ever and made class so fun. He's so understanding with students, especially considering the virtual format and all that. He's also not a harsh grader. He's so passionate about what he does and it really comes off on screen. If you have the choice, pick Swanlek for comm107, you definitely won't regret it. The nicest coolest most understanding person ever.
Great teacher, super nice, and grades pretty leniently. Her feedback is helpful and she grades in a timely manner.
Very kind and willing to work with you. Zoom classes got boring sometimes. Some assignments felt like useless busy work.

Very chill professor, has a great sense of humor and understands that not everyone is a good speaker. Sometimes grades strictly if you make mistakes but gives you useful feedback on how to improve. Definitely a good choice if you need to take this class.
So chill and understanding. Definitely would recommend, great teacher and none of the workload was too much at all.
This dude is wackyyy and so chill. Barely any work. Lectures were fun and engaging. Being all online, this was the only class to genuinely put a smile on my face during lectures.

Very helpful, awesome teacher. Probably my most organized professor since going online. Step-by-step rundown of each weeks assignments/ what we are going to do. I am expecting an A. She is also very sweet and accommodating!

didn't really love the class in my own opinion, but it was fine. She is very open and engaged. Her feedback is helpful but she will heavillyy critique your outlines even though it's just for comm107. However she graded lighter than expected for the actual presentations (based on how much she would critique the outlines). She's a good professor, I just didn't like the class itself.

Pretty chill and gives you genuine feedback on your presenting skills. Had her for online comm107 and it was pretty relaxed, just stay on top of your assignments and put some effort in and its an easy A.
Best Professor Ever ! Very understanding, explains the course well, she helped improve my speech skills, and so much more . I enjoyed taking COMM 107 with her !

Ms. Pope's class was one of those classes were she wasn't about to let you slack off and do nothing, however, everything you would ever do in the class would be for the genuine purpose of you becoming a better speaker in class. She was an awesome teacher and she made class really fun and engaging through a bunch of in class activities and she was also super helpful in clarifying topics or guidelines for assignments. She's a fair grader too and leaves a ton of feedback on every assignment you do. 10/10 recommend taking her course. Only thing I didn't like was the textbook but that's just cuz textbooks are absolute ass with any class.

I feel like she wasn't always super considerate of the circumstances her students were facing. I distinctly remember an email where she told me "The pandemic is not an excuse for you to not attend class." This was when I decided to take class online for 2 days right before spring break (where UMD practically forced students to go home) in order to avoid possibly infecting my family, some of whom are high risk.

Great professor, very understanding and actually cares about your progress. Made this class as stress free as possible. You still had to put in the effort to get a good grade, but Montgomery makes sure that the class does not take up a ridiculous amount of time in your day. The amount of work he gave was fair. You literally cannot go wrong by taking the class with him.
Was my favorite professor this semester. She is caring and understanding. Also a great teacher that explains everything clearly and grades fairly. Highly recommend taking COMM 107 with her!

Professor Lee is a really easy grader, and her feedback really helps with improving your public speaking. Although the work given before an assignment may seem like busywork, it honestly helped fortify concepts for the class. I would definitely recommend her to anyone.
Super sweet professor who always made his lectures straight to the point.  He grades quick and is super helpful and gives great advice.

The class was very laid-back with an easy workload and easy grading, as long as you stay on top of assignments and get things done in a timely manner. Professor Robbins is one of the nicest professors, and will allow for work to be slightly late with a good explanation and will extend deadlines if necessary.

I don't normally write reviews on professors but Aaron is the goat! Great lecturer and very lenient grading. He is very knowledgeable and will help you whenever you need it. His classes also end early most of the time.

Thomas is amazing! He genuinely cares about your success and well-being. He is very flexible and is THE fastest grader and responds to emails almost instantly. He knows comm107 is a gen-ed and is no one's priority, so if you just turn in all the assignments an A is guaranteed. The speeches aren't that bad and he's a very lax grader. Just don't go over or undertime, and you'll most likely get a 95-100%. He's a great lecturer and makes class so much fun. Also he lets us out of class early most days which is nice.

She is extremely nice and as long as you do the presentations, you will pass the class. She's a easy grader and will allow you to get an extension if you just talk with her. Also had a lot of fun conversations with her in class.
Very vulnerable and understanding guy. Quizes are very easy and open book, the work load in general is very laid back. He's also very funny
Easy prof. Likes marshmallow sweet potato tho so kinda weird
Great professor. Gives you every possible opportunity to do well and earn points in this course. Show up to class and put in some effort and you will get an A.
Where do i start with her.... Excellent communicator, you can tell she has a PhD in this field. Very accommodating to students, and overall, just a very sensible person.

She's a great teacher, but a bit bad at technology. Comm classes are an unnecessarily long 1hr and 15 minutes, but she keeps it somewhat entertaining. She grades pretty leniently and she's very friendly and understanding. There are weekly quizzes, but they're pretty easy to guess. As long as you stay on top of the class, it's an easy A.

Sean ya boy is a legend,

Pretty chill class ngl. Allowed you to turn in assignments late, like all quizzes due last day of class. Other assignments with due dates usually can be turned in late. Grading on speeches were relaxed, pretty much everyone got As or Bs. 

Really got along with all the students, class was pretty much just free time so everything was just chill, we barely worked on assignments.

Want the easiest and best comm 107 experience? Take Sean Rhodes!

BEST TEACHER ON CAMPUS! So understanding and laidback and knows that students have other things going on so he makes the class as easy as possible. As long as you show up and give your speech you will get an A+ in the class. Makes everyone feel so comfortable in the class that giving the speeches is a piece of cake. If you can take this class with this teacher 100% DO IT1!
His lectures are engaging and he is a fun person to talk to! He is very understanding and wants the best for his students. You can tell he enjoys teaching and that makes the class enjoyable.
She is super nice and understanding of your needs. VERY easy grader, so you can expect an A as long as you do all the work on time.

Do not take this professor. The entire semester he just lectures you for the entirety of the class and does not stop talking. The end of the semester came and it felt like he just gave up. We had a presentation in October that he still hasn't given grades back for and tomorrow is the last class. We haven't had class since November 16th, but he posted a video on Monday deciding to tell us oh yeah, we have a presentation in two days and we're getting graded on eye contact (so we have to write a whole speech AND memorize it in two days). He wouldn't respond to emails, and now he's giving us all of these assignments (like 5 assignments) that are due next week during finals- far beyond the class's end. So he went MIA for the past few weeks, and then decides to throw all of this work at us just when finals are beginning. As a student, it's so frustrating and no professor should do this to his students.
Super nice, understanding, will help you if needed. Very organized, fun class.
She's very transparent with due dates/information and grades quickly (tough grader on outlines, less so on the presentation itself). No reason not to take her.
Very easy COMM107 class. Leach makes it impossible not to get an A.

Super caring and friendly person and an amazing professor. She grades very easily and just really wants you to improve as a communicator. Coursework was very light, but you may have to grind for a couple of hours the day before presentations. She knows it's a Gen-ed so she tries to make it go as smooth as possible. The only slight problem is that the class itself is very boring, but that's not on Professor Aragon, that's the class in general. Highly recommend.

TAKE HER!!! by far the best instructor i've ever had. she's very kind and makes a class about presenting as interesting as possible. speeches weren't crazy difficult and she gave us lots of feedback before speech day. i know a class on presenting can be scary to many but she literally does brief breathing exercises before speeches to help nerves :)
The best professor ever, fairly easy class if you follow within the rubric.

I'm confused by the over reviews listed below because I thought she was an excellent prof. She was so sweet and actually made the class entertaining with her fun anecdotes. I really enjoyed her class.

She is the most caring person ever! She cares about her students and is really flexible in terms of assignments and grades. You will need to put effort in this course, but it is very manageable. She also creates a very safe environment that made public speaking a little less daunting. Overall, if you need to take this course, take it with Fromm you won't regret it.

Golden is very energetic and you'll never find yourself bored in his class. He is truly passionate about what he does and cares about each students' future. You should get an A as long as you follow the rubric and stay within the time limit.

I don't recommend taking Comm 107 with Duli Shi. She was a very harsh grader and made us sign a statement at the start of class saying we weren't attending UMD to be average. She made this class unnecessarily difficult. The textbook reading is self explanatory and the textbook quizzes count for very little, so I'd skip paying the $40.

Professor Golden was not my favorite. He can be sassy and tough on students, but honestly as long as you do what the rubric says and show effort he will give you an A. As someone who is not enthused about presentational speaking, I dreaded his class at times. I managed to get an A but it definitely required a lot of work. If you go up to him in class and ask him questions about your speech he is very willing to help, which is nice.

Hands down the best professor I have had. There are three speeches throughout the course of the semester which are all pretty easy. I did not practice my speeches very much before giving them to the class and managed to pull an A on every one. He is a very lenient grader and understands public speaking is not for everyone. There are a few quizzes but they are worth a very small percent of your grade. They are online so the answers are in the textbook or google. Bonded with students allowing them to navigate the class rather than teach straight from the book. Show up to class to get details about upcoming speeches and get participation points. If you miss a day of class it's not a big deal as you can make up points unless you are presenting that day.

Very dedicated and passionate professor about teaching COMM107. It was her first time teaching in the US and she did great. Most people expect an easy professor where they can skip and do the bare minimum work to pass the class... well if this is what you're looking for I'm telling you right now she will make you work for your grade in a reasonable manner and takes attendance for each class. You will end up being a more confident public speaker (I took this class in person) and you will learn something from it. Take her if you want to learn something.
Good

She is very nice but I didn't really learn any new material in this class. Her lectures are word for word what the textbook readings are and your grade depends mainly on the presentations. As long as you can speak decently in front of the class you will get an A. If you want to actually enhance your communication skills I would take another professor but if you are looking for an easy A I would recommend her.

This class is pretty straightforward. I hate public speaking, but Cassondra provides good feedback after every speech and keeps the environment decently light. You do need a decent amount of time to prep, but if you put in the work you should be good. She doesn't take nonsense from anyone, but overall I had a good time and felt like I actually learned from this class.

Top tier professor who not only keeps you engaged in lecture, but understands that people have lives outside of class. 

I typically have neutral feelings towards professors, but Dr.Fromm has got to be one of my favorites.

Just from the start of class, she would come in with a jocular mood, and set the tone well for the class. She was never monotone, and never contradicted herself. What I mean by the contradiction, is that there may be some communications professor who speaks in a monotone manner, isn't really prepared for class, and simply make the lecture useless or boring to go to. She isn't like that. I may have went on my computer a few times in lecture from being off task, but I wish I cherished having her as a professor more.

As a person, she's 10/10. The course is organized well, as there is not many assignments you have to do in a short period of time. Even cramming the speeches at the end is not a crazy task to do (although, I advise you not to do that lol). There's 10 quizzes throughout the semester, 4 speeches (including an online asynchronous final speech), and the rest of the assignments are graded on participation/completion.

Structure of the course is amazing, as well as the person teaching it.

Only Con I'd say is that the 4th edition of the textbook is on libgen, but the class required the 5th edition of that book, so I had to pay $30 on this website to rent the book for 6 months. The quizzes are open note, so you could use the textbook with the quiz (questions on the quiz are based off of the textbook).

If you have the chance to take it with Dr.Fromm, I say you do. She takes everything into account because she knows people have lives at the end of the day. What more could you ask for from a professor?
Super nice teacher. Very easy grading, especially for the last two (of four) major assignments. She is also flexible if you communicate with her.
Lenient grader and gives lots of respect.

He has clear expectations and can be a bit sassy at times but as long as you follow the rubric and stay within the time frame for your speeches, you will do well in his class. If you are having trouble, just talk to him because he will try to help you out.

He is truly the best professor who tries to make sure that you learn all the important things while practicing giving your speeches formally and also host a laid-back atmosphere that everyone would feel comfortable talking about the things that they like during class. He frequently end his class early so even though I have a walk conflict with my next class after his class, I don't even have to worry about it at all. Most importantly, he is a lenient grader but also make sure that you would get constructive feedback on your given speeches so that you clearly know what you need to work on further and improve for your future speeches in the class. Make sure to take him if you can.

For a public speaking class, there was a lot of other useless stuff she made us do. She was very tough to work with when doing the work and a very poor/unfair grader. Other Comm teachers are better from what I've seen and heard from my friends.
Really caring and understanding teacher, you will definitely enjoy her class!!!

Donia is AMAZING. As someone with lots of speaking anxiety, she created the perfect environment to present. She is EXTREMELY EMTREMELY EXTREMELY lenient on all the presentations which allowed me to focus on actually presenting well as I was not focused the grades. She made her own quizzes that were because the question bank had very confusing questions.
Good

Worst Comm107 professor. Was such an easy class that she somehow made difficult. She will never answer your emails and will grade extraordinarily harshly without any feedback as of why or how to improve. She is strangely picky and if you don't do things exactly how she likes she will dock you points from it. On top of all that she was rude to her students and would single them out in class acting as if she was "teasing" or "joking around" with them but would just end up making the student and their peers uncomfortable. I hate to leave a comment like this but this is an easy class that should be relatively enjoyable whether you take it as a freshman or as a senior and she makes it awful and will mess up ur GPA when it should be an easy A+. I would give a zero if I could. She was one of the worst professors I've had and would rather take another difficult science course than any course with her because they I can at least gauge whether I'm going to do well or not and not just hope for the best and then get screwed over.

Prof. Bruner is one of the kindest professors I met. She is very understanding of circumstances and is a fair grader. If you put the effort in then you will surely succeed in that class. She gives you all the materials and lessons to be prepared for this class.

Dr. Olson was the most amazing teacher ever. She was very well-organized, super nice and caring to her students, and also so funny. I was so sad when my class with her ended because I am just going to miss her personality so much. I definitely 1000% recommend Dr. Olson.
She was the worst professor I had. She was nice as a person but a terrible professor. She told me I wasn’t going to pass. Withdrew to get away from her.

This guy is a great professor. He is very down to earth and real with the students in his class. One thing I will say is don't take this class if you want an easy COMM professor who doesn't care much about the speeches. Dan will give you real feedback that will genuinely help you become a better public speaker and tends to be a harsh grader on the non speech assignments (such as outlines and reflections). However, if you take COMM with him, you will definitely come out a better speaker at the end of the semester.

One of the best teachers I have had at UMD. If you are nervous about comm, please take it with her. As long as you are respectful she will give you so much in return and understands we have lives outside of school.

Thomas is the best!  We had weekly quizzes on the textbook where everything was copy and paste, and we had three attempts- it's impossible to fail them.  I took the class on Zoom so it was all recorded lectures but he was super chill about grading!  He knows that most people are just there for the requirement and is really understanding of it and doesn't give a lot of work.  He is fun and even lets us call him by his first name!  Definitely one of the best comm professors from what I have heard from my other friends!  10/10 recommend he's the best!

Thomas is an enthusiastic and flexible professor. He grades assignments fast, gives great constructive reviews, and allows extensions easily if you ask him with a good reason (an important exam from another class coming up on the same due date as his class or something like that). As long as you turn assignments in on time and show efforts in your speech (slides and note cards), As are guaranteed. Most of the time, he lets students out of class early and he is fun to listen and talk to.

Took his class as a freshman Fall 2021. Felt he did a good job of illustrating his points to his students as a communications professor. Assignments and speeches were straightforward. Only giving him 4 stars out of 5 because he didn't really do anything that made him spectacular. He was good, but not great.

AWESOME PROF!
Did not care abt attendance and was a very helpful grader in the sense of deadlines.
He's honestly such a goat and really cares about us. Every class he checks in to make sure we're ok and he really understands burnout.

There are two types of COMM107 professors: those who don’t care about teaching and those who do care. Dr. Soeder is the latter. She is great at providing clear and constructive feedback and is very engaging. I enjoyed showing up to her class and she is an excellent professor. However, she definitely believes that there is no such thing as a perfect outline or presentation. If you truly want to learn in COMM107, then take her. But don’t expect to get an easy A with no effort because she holds her students to a high standard.

Professor Zhang is a solid professor. She taught the material well enough, all her presentations were in bullet-point form so it was easy to get notes down. She was also accommodating with presentations and tried to help students overcome stage fright over the course of the semester. Good professor, took a star away because it was really boring and I played crossword puzzles all class.

honestly THE BEST comm class prof ever. He genuinely care about his students and made the classes so engaging. I hate public speaking but all the exercises we did in class really help me overcome the fear of public speaking so take his class guys

Only good things to say about her!! She really tried hard to get the class to know each other, which made me more comfortable to do presentations. She is extremely understanding with getting assignments done and if you need an extension, just ask her. She is also a student, so she knows the struggles. She is very approachable and is willing to go get coffee or something with you if you need help. When it comes to the presentations, she is a fairly easy grader if you get it done and present. She is good with giving feedback too. I know the name of professors for COMM classes do not come out till last minute, but if you can, I REALLY recommend trying to get her.

Very nice, very understanding, and incredibly easy grader. Literally if you don't have a mental breakdown in front of the class during a presentation you're getting at least a 90. Pretty much no homework outside of prepping for speeches, so definitely highly recommend.
She was very easy and cool. Very understanding and grades easy.

An absolutely wonderful professor. People say that she is a lenient grader but I think its mostly because she actually grades fairly compared to other COMM professors how appear to have massive egos. She is super nice and will always be willing to help you out. The course was really relaxing and honestly kind of fun thanks to her grading. You will learn, have fun, and come out with a better grade in COMM than most.

So so nice and created a positive, low-stress classroom environment. She's very understanding and made an effort to connect with students. I really struggle with public speaking anxiety but she made it less stressful and she never took points off for visible nerves or anything along those lines, and she always praised me when I got my nerves under control. Just do the presentations and you'll get an easy A!
Best professor I’ve had at UMD

T is overall a very nice guy. However, he can get a bit sassy and passive-aggressive at times. If you can get over that aspect, I would definitely recommend taking COMM107 with him. He is very lenient with grading (I never got below a 90% on speeches) and is very understanding too (I forgot to do a quiz one time and he let me take it past the due date). He took the time to learn everyone's name, as well as memorize little facts about us which I found to be very caring. Attendance is definitely mandatory for every class, so don't mess around with that.

He’s a nice professor and knows what he’s teaching, but he is not considerate at all toward his students. He is also very strict when it comes to grading the speeches, points will be taken off if your hands are in ur pockets for a couple minutes, and even if u submit an assignment 5 minutes late he will not accept.

As someone who was nervous to take this course and speak in front of a class and be graded on it, I was pleasantly surprised by Professor Phipps' approach. She was so kind, forgiving, and thoughtful towards her students and truly wanted them to succeed. She allows you to pick whatever topic you want, as long as it follows the constraints of the speech assignment. She also is a good communicator, and sometimes allows asynchronous class times for you to work on your speeches. This course is the same among all Professors, but you will have to do 4 speeches - Informative, Persuasive, Group, and Final (Special Occassion); 10 quizzes that follow the course of the online textbook; and activities that are drawn from your participation. Professor Phipps is an excellent grader and is very forgiving for mistakes. 

Take her!! You won't regret it!!
Professor Shin's pretty good for COMM107. She knows what she's doing and COMM107 is pretty easy already. Just show up, do your work, and you'll pass with flying colors.

He isn't a bad teacher just not the most considerate. He spends a lot of class time talking about his personal experiences and life advice, it's relevant but not worth talking about almost every day. His grading is pretty harsh and he has an "I accept no excuse except the one I have no say in" attitude. He has clear favorites in his classes and you won't really improve unless you meet up with him or other professors outside of class time. The class is passible but I recommend other professors.

Really bias grader. you kinda have to sell yourself to her (and the class) so she likes you. Goes off on really long tangents and is all over the place but doesn't give too much work, watch out for the writing center visit requirement. sometimes you can get other work done in her class too.

She was really nice and engaging and she was also able to provide tips for public speaking from her past relevant experiences. I don’t even like public speaking but I enjoyed this class and felt like I gained useful tips.

Class is easy enough to pass but his attitude is what made the class unbearable. It is very clear he loves to hear himself talk and was very rude to students if they did not say something agreeable to him. He's not considerate at all and won't admit to when he makes mistakes and spends entire class periods talking about himself. There were a couple online quizzes that were straight out of the textbook but other than that the only assignments were the 3 speeches we had to make about whatever we wanted, and one of them was a group speech. If you are okay with a rude professor if you want to get in easy A, then this class is it. But I would recommend looking anywhere else.

Avoid this SOB at all costs! I don’t get all the views at the bottom saying he is a “nice guy”. Mr. Golden is a very rude, arrogant, and narcissistic individual who will eat you alive. 

He is a harsh grader, grifter, and adopts all sort of weird policies that make this gen ed unnecessarily harder so you can be “professional”. Also he acts like a department dean of Harvard while he is just a salaried lecturer.

If you want an easy pass with this gen-ed, this professor is your way to go! She is very friendly and nice, willing to help you to make progress with the course and get scores (yes, with her heart). Rubrics are very clear, follow them and you can get high scores indeed. By putting in effort (you do not really need too much, just a moderate amount), reaching A or A+ is definitely and highly possible. I got A- because I was aiming for 'minimum time to pass'. (that means minimum effort can grant A-, basically). Readings can be skimmed through, you do not need to do much, professor Agboada has put a lot of information and solid good stuff in her videos. In this summer II session, her weekly synchronous check-in is helpful in keeping you on track. Overall great course experience.
One of the best instructors I've had so far in college! Very engaging, charming, and has an experience-based teaching style which was very effective.

I took Professor Agboada’s online summer course and it was an absolute treat. She is without a doubt one of the kindest and most helpful instructors I’ve ever had. She gives plenty of constructive criticism, while also grading generously. I highly recommend that anyone taking this course online takes it with Ms. Agboada.
Prof. Truban is a great professor and is well-organized. Presentations are fairly easy and manageable. The homework and quizzes are easy it's something you can manage to do it.
She's a great professor. Her quizzes and home work are fairly easy. Expect a lot of presentations but it's because this is a communication class other than that this is an easy class.

Crystal is a great teacher and would recommend. She has the perfect balance of ensuring that the class is easy enough for people who just want to get the gen ed, while making it engaging for people that would like to pay attention. As a person, she is very accommodating and nice, and made our class feel like a friend group. The main grades in the class are weekly quizzes and 3 speeches throughout the semester. The quizzes are straight forward and you are given weeks to prepare for speeches that range from 3 - 7 minutes long.
One of my favorite professors here at UMD. Is super sweet, generous, friendly and approachable. Gives you extensions if needed and is super relatable. 10/10 loved her and the course!

Mr. T is a great guy and can teach his subject with a bit of fun humor. I never was the type of guy to do speeches and such, but being in that class with him made me more comfortable. Attendance is mandatory but I’m sure you will enjoy being in that class environment so it shouldn’t be a problem!

Austin is by far one of the most caring teachers I have ever had. He wants his students to succeed and offers great encouragement. He's funny and makes a typically boring class entertaining through his own experiences and stories. He embodies what a communications professor should be. Rather than a simple delivery of the content, he infuses the content with his own experience as a film-maker and illustrates the applications of the theoretical concepts discussed.

This class made me so angry. It should have been an easy A, but he's such a harsh grader that I find myself fighting for my life. Take anybody, BUT him. He is so extra for no reason and makes us do mini speeches every class. Also, if you miss a quiz, you don't get to make it up.
Easy to get an A-, but try hard on your outlines/speeches for an A+. quizzes are easy and you have the textbook.

Ari is super chill and keeps the class easy. COMM107 is fairly simple if you put a decent amount of work in, and Ari doesn't make things harder for the students. Highly recommend for a laid back easy COMM107 GenEd course
Go to class and u wil be ok
Mrs. K is the best!!!! She is very understanding if you need to miss class. She is always giving extensions when needed and grades pretty fairly. I recommend her class for COMM 107 credit.

Professor Sheikh grades so hard for absolutely no reason. She treats Comm like its a 400 level course and grades really hard. Since it's Comm, it's not the hardest class you'll ever take, but her harsh grading is beyond aggravating. I'm an A student struggling in a Comm class. That should say enough.
Great professor! Very understanding of students and tries to make presentations lively and engaging. Would definitely recommend to others
Awesome prof!
She's really nice and the class is pretty easy.
Relatively easy grader. Her lectures are not too interesting but I blame that more on the textbook/subject. Overall I would recommend.
Olivia is a fantastic professor. She is friendly, flexible on extensions, and very funny. Well-organized class. There is an online textbook used for quizzes, but quizzes are online.
Rudy is super sweet and her class is very easy. She genuinely wants her students to succeed.

She is sooooo good! She makes class so much more bearable. My other friends would always complain about the workload for this course with other professors but I never complained. She was very organized and made work so well split up, that most of it you can finish in class and would only spend max 1 hr SOMETIMES to finish up work. She is very understanding and truly cares about all her students. She has workshop days that are not mandatory but allows you to get extra feedback on assignments. Her expectations are very clearly stated, and as long as you hit them, you will get good grades. She gives feedback to everyone before the final deadline for an assignment, ensuring you get a good grade. I truly loved her as a professor and recommend her to everyone possible. If you see her name, Take Her!!!
The GOAT. Grades so easy, is a super chill grad student teacher. Impossible to fail unless you do literally nothing. Also went to middle school with kesha so thats tough.

Honestly, one of the greatest teachers I've had so far. Very understanding of how busy students can be, and always tries to make adjustments so that we are not that affected by the assignments from this course. Grades the presentation and other assignments VERY fair. Austin is the goat.
Easy quizzes, fun teacher, chill with deadlines and work. He actually likes teaching and he lets you use your laptop during speeches.

An incredibly nice teacher and a relatively easy class. The material is easy to understand and projects are broken down piece by piece and mostly done in class so it's not a huge workload. Yumin is very understanding when things go wrong, a relatively kind grader but definitely knows what she likes and is strict about criteria being met effectively. Definitely recommend her for Comm 107 you will learn a good amount about how to present well without being stressed.

Dr. Bruner somehow made a class that happened at 8AM and, as a bonus, involved me speaking for long periods of time to a room full of strangers an enjoyable experience. While I don't necessarily recommend that time slot, I would recommend taking her for COMM107 whenever you get around to it.
Absolutely fantastic person and very understanding. She makes the class as easy as it can be while you are still learning. If you can take her, do it.
If you need this class, take Dr. G. He’s a fair grader, very understanding, and overall just a cool guy. Plus, I saw an improvement in my public speaking. I recommend him 100%.

T is truly an amazing professor. He really cares about his students and their success in the class. He makes class fun, so I didn’t mind that class was mandatory. He took time to make sure he knew everyone’s name within the second week of class. I would definitely recommend taking comm with him.
Super nice and understanding about everything, grades very easily and the assignments aren't hard

Matthew  makes class so engaging and teaches useful information. He will make sure you are fully prepared for your speeches and will go over the rubric so you know how the grades work. Take his class if you can!!!! You will not be disappointed!!!!
AMAZING PROFESSOR!!! TAKE HER IF YOU CAN!!

Great teacher and makes class interesting! He provides great feedback and is very organized. Was actually a useful class and he understands if you miss a couple of classes for excused/unexcused reasons. Weekly quizzes with two attempts (so easy), and attendance worksheets (which you can do at home if you miss class.) Overall, I would recommend him and this class.

Rudy was an incredible professor. As a first-semester freshman, I feel like Rudy's class was a breath of fresh air. She always was happy and energetic and seemed like she wanted to be there. I think Rudy cares a lot about her students, and genuinely wanted us to all do well in her class.
Great comm prof
W teacher. Super nice, friendly, and very knowledgeable/passionate about comm. Class was fun and purposeful. Easy if you go to class.

If you need to take comm, take it with Ari. The classes are super chill and there is not that much work required. There are four speeches total. The most annoying part about the class is the group presentation just because group work in general sucks. But again if you need to take it, I highly recommend Ari.

Golden expects your speeches to be at least as good as Martin Luther King's "I have a Dream" speech. You have to memorize your entire speech or else you lose points for "not maintaining eye contact."
He is completely unreasonable and has double standards. He wastes half the class giving a lecture about some irrelevant life lesson. He loves to talk about himself. Avoid him at all costs.

I LOVE here. She is the best professor I have ever had. I am probably the worst public speaker but this class was very easy to get an A in as long as you simply complete your speech. She is so kind and genuinely cares about all her students. All my friends complained about this course with other professors, but with her I have no complaints and hardly no work outside of class. She held many workshops classes that were optional to come to on days we had class so often time class was "cancelled".
Not sure what changed between the older reviews and now, but Prof. Gowin has been a great instructor and I would highly recommend her!
Very kind guy and this class is very easy. By far my favorite Johnathan
Easy course. Chill and easy going professor. Will give you time extension if you ask her. Makes Friday lectures online and keeps the workload light.

Love her! She was very kind, considerate, and understanding. If you show that you're putting in effort for her class she will definitely give you a good grade. There were some impromptu presentations but they were very short and not that stressful.

I loved this class with professor pope. My comm class felt like a group of friends by the end of it and professor pope was a huge reason why. She encourages you to get to know everyone and her class assignments are super fun.

Professor Wu is genuinely an outstanding professor. She cares about her students and makes this class engaging. Her class is not hard and she makes this gen-ed incredibly easy and educational. I appreciate her kindness towards her students and she isn't too strict with grading, so she makes this class incredibly low-stress. 

Just as long as you show up and essentially practice the speeches in this class (they aren't as bad!), you will get an A+. I'm usually not the type of person to like public speaking, but this class has gotten me out of my shell regarding talking in front of people. I made friends with people in the class so it wouldn't be as awkward presenting, but overall, this class has prepared me to take risks and come out of my comfort zone around strangers. 

I adore Professor Wu a lot, she really is the best comm professor. I wish I had the time to go to her office hours but she is super sweet and has made me excited to go to this class because of her. She understands that sometimes students are shy or aren't the public-speaking type of person, but she believes in everyone in the class and makes it a comfortable environment for you to get used to public speaking. 

Take Professor Wu if you can!! :)

I really liked having this professor for COMM107. I was worried about taking this class because I have social anxiety and I'm not great at public speaking, but the class went pretty well for me. I received good grades for all of the speeches, and what I liked about regular class is that she never kept us longer than needed. Once she was done going through her slides for the day, she would let us go. If you have the chance to take her for COMM107, take her.
Fair teacher, good assignments with great feedback

Weekly quizzes, 3 speeches, and discussions. The lectures usually don't take the full time unless it's a speech day. Lenient grader and wants you to do well in this class. The only con is that she takes a little while to respond to emails. I would 100% take her if you see her for COMM107.

One of my favorite instructors I've had, she was very down to earth and felt like a real person. Always defined expectations clearly, and graded speeches and quizzes extremely fairly. Overall enjoyed this class, and learned a lot from it.
Very open-minded, flexible, enthusiastic, and wants you to succeed! Amazing professor.
Bruh pls dont take. He makes it hard for no reason. Take literally ANYONE ANYONE ANYONE else. This is comm, not the grammys plsss
Easy class. She makes this class easy and the load of homework is very light.

She made the class very easy, and if you missed points for any assignment, you could always email her for a make-up. My only issue with her was that she sometimes had some controversial things to say, and you can tell that she's a very traditional woman. I would take her for comm regardless, though. It was a very easy A

I'm literally on my hands and knees begging do not take this professor. He does not care about his students (like he claims to) and is a very harsh grader. He has no sympathy for his students and we literally get one singular note card and only one side of it. His class is boring and didn't learn a single thing. Do me a favor and stay far far away pls and thank you.

legit the best. matthew clearly cares about his students and wants to see them succeed. gives great feedback and helps you become a stronger speaker with each assignment. take his class if you can!! he's a g fr 100000000/10 would recommend

Dr. Soeder doesn’t make this class harder than it needs to be. The grading was really fair and it was pretty easy to get an A. Classes are a bit dry but that is expected from a public speaking class. We were let out 15-20 minutes early every class which was nice. I would definitely recommend taking Dr. Soeder for COMM 107 if you have the chance.

Great professor! Totally recommended.

Very friendly guy and approachable. He’s always super lenient and understanding with accommodations. Made the lectures more like fun conversations rather than lectures. Also an extremely fair grader!

He is THE BEST comm107 professor. Firstly the structure of the class is really nice. He gets the required quizzes out of the way early in the semester and everything is very straightforward (both in what you are supposed to do and when it is due). He is a super interesting person to listen to and really kind. He is a super fast grader and as long as you put in the effort (to create notecards and do your best on the assignments leading up to the speech which prepare you for it) you will get a good grade. He is also just really interesting to listen to and uses pretty fun examples in class. Will often let class out early so you just have to make sure you get the assignments in on time. Clearly has student's interests at heart and is willing to work with you. 100% recommend.

I love Professor Grossman. He was one of the best professors that I have had at maryland. He made public speaking fun and gave great feedback.
