I am really not a great public speaker but Professor Grossman really cares about his students and wants them to do well. He was so supportive and extremely generous and helpful. I love this man. Take this class when you need to fulfill your public speaking requirement. Grossman is HIM!

The reviews for the year 2022 for Golden was quite bad as you can see at the bottom. Not going to make excuses for the man. He can actually be a bit sassy at times and does love to hear himself talk unfortunately. If you are the shy type, you might not even like his class because he could randomly pick on you and put you on the spot, asking questions like "where you got your shirts from or what it means". But all in all, he actually cares about his students and his job and holds you to a higher standard. He is also really nice and willing to help if you are struggling. If you want an easy A, do not even take this class for real, but if you want to step outside your comfort zone for public speaking, then take his class

I loved taking this course with Professor Phipps. She is amazing and really wants her students to succeed. She allows you to pick your own topics, have notecards with you while presenting, very fair grader, gives great feedback and advice, and has asynchronous class times leading up to presentations which you can meet over zoom to work on your speech if wanted. She understands that group speeches suck with others not doing their share but honestly tries to make it fair. I have no regrets taking this course with her and would do it again if I had to.
never answered a single one of my emails. She's nice but that's super annoying because it ended up costing part of my grade.

Took her during the winter semester and she was great.
The workload wasn't bad at all. Definitely reccomend.

She was very nice and accommodating if you gave her a heads up about an issue. She was pretty straightforward when it came to grading. As long as you do the homework (easy 10 question quizzes) and do well enough on your speeches, it is an easy A.

She was very passionate about this course and made it very clear what she expected of us! I took COMM107 in the Winter and thought it was a breeze. Showing up to all classes is necessary but she does not give a lot of work. This was a very reasonable class and I would take it again in a heartbeat!

T is a really nice guy and wants everyone in his class to pass. Just making sure you even do the work in his class will guarantee an A. He's very lenient and understanding of people's situations and accommodates accordingly.

Professor Wu is one of the sweetest professors ever. She cares so much about teaching and really wants to make her class engaging. She was always so encouraging and really tried to make changes to the class that we thought would be effective. Her class is not hard, in fact, she intentionally tries to make it really easy. We have reading quizzes for like 10 weeks, which are easy and you have unlimited attempts. Besides that, there are 3 major presentations that she was so thorough about explaining and made sure we really understood what we were doing. The final is also so easy and low stress it took me maybe 20 minutes. She gave really good feedback and was always super kind. I hate public speaking but I swear she makes it so low-stress. She is so understanding of the fears people have and share with us her own experiences to try to make them lighter. Anytime we felt like we might be embarrassed she would share a story about herself to make us feel more comfortable. If you have the opportunity to take her class I would totally recommend it.

Very nice and cares about you as a person. Class is easy, just do the assignments and show up. She is a bit of a stickler about formatting and citations and stuff for presentations, but overall a great professor who tries to keep things interesting and fair.

Professor Choi is very sweet and does her best to help make this class comfortable despite the natural fears that come with speaking in front of people. Gives good feedback on speech outlines and grades leniently. Highly recommend!
100% my favorite professor I have ever had here. He is so so nice and immediately puts you in a great mood. Amazing at teaching and ALWAYS open to help!! UMD needs more people like him.

Yumin is very friendly and sweet, her class feels pretty cozy and she makes it easy. She genuinely cares about your wellbeing and will offer tons of help so you can't go wrong. Her feedback for each speech is spot-on and will help you better prepare for the next. The criteria and expectations for each speech and assignment could not be more clear. I don't think there is a better instructor for COMM107

She's a really nice and caring professor, if you have any problems she always tries her best to help. Had her for comm107 and it was a great time for me. comm107 in itself really sucked for me because it was related to public speaking but she did try to make it a bit more fun. She has a... bubbly personality and it tends to lead towards awkward situations in class usually. Also, she is a bit of a tough grader, you have to have a really good speech for her to give you good marks, otherwise you will get stuck with a B- or C+ grade.

Dr. Mashanda is an excellent option for COMM107. Although his course structure can be confusing and he had to miss 1-2 classes during the Winter semester, he is willing to forgive penalties on late work and provides stellar grades to any assignment submitted with effort. With the proper effort, you can always expect an “A” in COMM107 with Dr. Mashanda.
This guy sucks. He's so full of himself and takes this joke of a gen ed way too serious
very lenient, kind, understanding. wants to see u winning. i miss her already
She is so nice and genuinely wants to help. Dont be off put by her meticulousness. She really is looking for confidence.

Austin is a good teacher. He is a PhD student, so he would sometimes joke around with us if someone calls him "Professor." He is pretty funny and is very understanding if people don't show up to class. He is also a very fair grader, and he keeps the class engaged with some of his work and experience as a film maker. Please take COMM107 with him. He's great!

SHE IS AMAZING
seriously she is so down to Earth and still helps everyone learn the course material. I would honestly take every single one of my classes from her if I could and I could not recommend her enough. She really does care and wants everyone to have a good time in class, which is so appreciated when a lot of other classes and professors could not care less. All of the assignments are well outlined and well communicated and getting good grades on them is simply following the rubric and trying. Her advice and comments on presentations were not out of the box and genuinely helped everyone. Love.

Olivia is a really great professor! She makes class engaging and knows what she is talking about. I personally hate public speaking, but Olivia made it manageable and was very supportive of all of us and genuinely wanted us to do our best.
please do not take this teacher, very harsh, very strict, expects you to make a speech like MLK. Very sassy, please do not take this teacher

Most of his class is taken up by his personal stories and teachings. Most of the quizzes are pretty easy and are based off the textbook which is expected to be read outside of class. Other than that he's a horrible professor, he expects every talk to be some TEDx talk and grades very harshly, he has a huge ego and is never wrong, if you ever have problems with an assignment he will not help you fix it. He loves to hear himself talk, and is extremely sassy. Literally the first assignment was writing about his autobiography, if that's not a red flag for a professor than idk. just dont't take this professor.
Grades super harsh, has no reason to be this tough for a 100 level class

The dude is aight. He has decently engaging lectures but grades unreasonably harshly for a gen-ed like COMM107. He will give you massive point deductions for stupid details on the assignments and seems to take points off the speeches for the sake of doing so. Don't expect to earn above an A- on your presentation even if you thoroughly research and practice your speech. Overall, I guess he's not terrible if you can't find anyone else. But you're better off with a professor who actually grades based on effort and cares about your improvement. This guy grades like he has some sort of dignity to uphold.

Nice guy but don't recommend. He's such a harsh grader. This class should be such an easy A but its not with him. He wont let you make up quizzes if you miss one. He takes points off for the most random things too. He also assigns a lot of work for what the class is. I don't usually write reviews but I don't want anyone whos taking comms to make the same mistake I did.

She is a great comm professor, super energetic and chill. Her exercises are helpful, and she does give time to work on assignments in class. It's super chill, mostly group projects and really easy online quizzes that you get to use your textbook on.
If you want an easy grade don’t take this professor

Seems like a nice guy outside the classroom. I can tell he is passionate about the subject and cares about students improvement, and is willing to meet outside of class to work on assignments. But this guy is so entitled. Thinks COMM is the most important subject. Literally said first day of class "this is the most important class you will take at this school" or something along those lines. So he thinks his class is the most important out of all your classes, and it seems like he expects you to put in that level of work but this class is just a gened. I understand communication is an important subject, but when you downplay the other classes students take it really irks me the wrong way. I can also tell he plays favorites, and I am clearly not one of his favorites. Takes points off for random small details. Also said whoever didn't read the chapter are "failing to be adults." If you are looking for a chill class to take, do not take this class with this guy.

He takes this class WAY to seriously. He always says that his class if more important than my major classes. Keep in mind I am an Aerospace Engineering student. He grades super harshly for a communications course. I haven't received a 100/100 on any assignment he was able to grade himself. TAKE ANYONE ELSE especially if you are Engineering or another hard major and you want an easy way out.

Very awkward lecturer and toughest COMM107 grader I have ever heard of. Handed out mainly C's on a three minute informative speech while all other professors generally hand out A's. They also bring personal stances on the topics of the speeches into play by telling students that disagree with them to change their topic or it will be reflected in their grade. Stay away!!!

Super easy class, it really helps with getting better at presenting. We can choose our own topics, work with her to help make our speech, and there are a lot of asynchronous classes which make the class super light.

This professor grades based on whether or not he agrees with your topic or not. If you propose a topic that he does not agree with, you will be forced to change it or suffer bad grades moving forward.
Alex is horrible. Bad lecturer, worse person. If Alex is the only option left take the class another time.

She's very understanding and gives you enough chances to do well in the class and ear points. She gives you very good comments on your presentation outlines and presentations. You'll be able to earn an A in the class stress free as long as you show up and put some effort in.

Divine is an AWESOME guy. He is super funny and really wants to get to know his students. He is open to talking about anything and just learn about what people are passionate about. As a professor he is good too, but I would say that he lacks a bit of experience. It was annoying when he would assign us reading quizzes with only a 16-18 hour window to complete it, or even for speech outlines we wouldn't be able to see the guidelines for as assignment until a few days before it was due. This was inconvenient and frustrating at times. Aside from that, he strongly follows rubrics for grading but gives great feedback and expects students to build upon his feedback as the semester moves forward (he wants us to improve!!). COMM107 in my opinion isn't an overly difficult course, but I believe there are other professors who make this class a little bit less difficult/inconvenient at times. I had a great time with Divine because we connected well personally. I think down the line with some more experience and learning how to teach, he can be an outstanding professor because again he is truly a good guy.

Ditto to the comment below. One of the first things he warns you about the first class is that he takes his class seriously, and you should drop if you aren't ready to do "well" in COMM. I thought he was bluffing, but he was obviously not and is super spiteful. He genuinely thinks that COMM107, a GENED class, is the most important class ever. I consider myself a hard-working student, and I have never had a problem with public speaking and am constantly getting mediocre scores on my speeches. My roommate, who says he looks at his slides and never practices his presentations with another professor, is getting high 90s on each presentation, and in my first one, I got an 85%. 

Dan PICKS favorites, and sometimes it's really awkward and weird, and you can tell who he enjoys talking to and who he doesn't. Also, he highkey cursed out our class one day because someone wasn't paying attention, and he told us it's insane we weren't paying attention because "nothing is more important than COMM". He genuinely thinks you need to put in 10+ hours a week into COMM and COMM > your other classes. 

He has exceptionally high standards; he's probably just annoyed he got stuck teaching a 100-level course. You should take an 8 AM with a professor with no reviews over him. TRUST me.
Hes the best comm professor. His class schedule is organized very well and the way he speaks is very entertaining. He looks like he actually likes teaching the class which is nice.

So Mr. Garnier is a nice guy who makes a really easy class. The class is mostly just him lecturing and was very quiet for a public speaking class, so I found it boring. He doesn't make the class do discussions or really participate. You are graded for attendance though, so I'd recommend showing up for easy points instead of doing the make-up activities later. He's a generous grader, gave me A's on all the speeches, even when I didn't feel good about it. 

I gave 3 stars because it was at 8 AM, he didn't give time to do any work in class like speech planning - just lecturing all the time and it got really repetitive - and I would have liked to have more speeches and practicing instead of all the theory and just 3 speeches, 1 of which was a group project. If you want an easy A without much work and you're fine with giving speeches then take him. If you actually want more practice getting comfortable speaking and an engaging class, I would look elsewhere.

Dr. Lucas is super sweet, and a very understanding professor. She often let us out 30 minutes early in class. There are only three main presentations throughout the class, and a weekly quiz that can be completed in a few minutes. The workload in the class is honestly minimal, which is good for a gen-ed. As long as you prepare your speeches and follow the rubric she posts for her presentation requirements, you will get an A. The class is great for anyone to take, as it helped me greatly with public speaking. Awesome professor, would definitely take again!

He is a nice person and fun to talk to, but he is not treating this class as a beginning communications class. Everything was graded very harshly and you will need to put in a good deal of work to meet his requirements for a good grade. If you are in a hard major and do not have time to prioritize a gen-ed I would recommended taking any other teacher. Literally anyone else but him. He likes to talk about himself most of the class and randomly tells us personal details about himself that I rather not hear about. Then tells us we are like his group therapy when he rants about random topics every morning.

He thinks this class is the most important class you will ever take, and acts on it. He is full of himself and narcissistic and has genuinely talked crap about other professors and has hinted that he personally thinks he's the most intellectual professor (when the man teaches a gen-ed 100-level course). He has favorites. He makes COMM107, a supposedly easy gened for others, feels like a 300-level class for your major.

I would take this class a million more times. Professor Madoo makes it extremely interesting. She incorporates stories from her personal experiences and does not shy away from humor when discussing. Exams are an hour long and open note. If you take notes in class and read the textbook (she points out specific pages) you will get an A+. There is a policy of no electronics, but don't take that as an opportunity to not take this class. Her engaging manor makes up for it. Also, there is only the exams and 1 short paper.

BEST PROFESSOR EVER I CANNOT STRESS THIS ENOUGH. He is so interesting, and engaging. He is so funny, which makes you want to come to class. He uses great examples and is an overall great teacher. He always lets us out early, because if we have work that can be done independently, he does not see the need to keep you. The class was an hour and fifteen but I was often never in there for more than 35-40 minutes. He is such a fast grader, grades automatically, and for speeches, your grade is there within the minute after your speech. He lays out all expectations and if you submit your work on time, and genuinely work hard on the assignments leading up to speeches, you will get a great grade. If you submit assignments really early, he will grade it, and if it is not 100, you can resubmit it before it is due, and get points. Highly recommend taking this course.

Had Rudy for Comm107 for Fall 2022 and she was the GOAT. Always down to help her students and always was super enthusiastic every time you walked into her classroom. She was also very welcoming and made us feel comfortable.

Awful teacher. Stuck up and irritating. Boring lectures. Grades hard for no reason. Miss one class and lose 10% on your monthly attendance grade. Unless you are willing to spend as much time on COMM 107 as any other major related class, your likelihood of getting an A is microscopic with this moron.

I don't know why so many people rated him so low. They are just dramatic. This man is easily the best teacher I have ever had in my life. You can tell he cares about his students a lot. He remembers personal stories and things like that so you know he cares. He is an easy grader if you do the work. He doesn't take off points for stuttering, and stuff like that. I expected a B- and I got a 97%.

Hands down the best professor I have had at UMD so far. He genuinely cares about all of his students, and goes out his way to make sure we understand concepts in the class. Your public speaking will definitely get better! Highly recommend taking Dr. Foster's class!
Dr. Jade is a fun, clear, energetic, and approachable to professor. No exams, four presentations, all graded really leniently and she leaves great feedback.
Ms. Kim is great! So kind, understanding, and encouraging when trying to improve everyone’s public speaking skills and speech preparation skills. I’d definitely recommend taking COMM 107 with her.

Olivia is the best! She is super funny, chill, and relatable. COMM107 can seem like an intimidating course, but she made it super managable. There are 3 in-person speeches: informative, persuasive, and a group presentation. The final is virtual and SUPER low-stakes. Class literally never went the full 1 hr 15 min and there were a lot of classes that ended being held through zoom. I highly recommend Olivia if you are able to take her.

Super kind, but weird grading. Her grading was for the most fair, but sometimes she would take points off for weird things or she would take a lot of points off on one really small thing. She was really great while grading actual speeches, but the outlines were graded really harshly. Overall, her class was as good as COMM107 was going to be.

Its incredible how many of the other reviews are so salty about actually being pushed to grow and develop in a subject instead of being just an easy A while learning nothing. The fact is that a lot of people just cant do public speaking, myself included, and will go up in front of a room full of people and start mumbling or deliver a presentation dryer than a popeyes biscuit. Professor Golden actually pushes you to improve, and really holds you to a high standard, but he really knows his stuff and is probably the best teacher you can get if you want to actually get better. He's a public speaking coach for high society big shot type professionals and has tons of connections around campus, and more generally has a lot of life advice too beyond just public speaking. He really wants to see all his students succeed, and also will build personal bonds with students. Best advice for Golden is to show up to class early, apply yourself and really intend to improve, and you will see dramatic changes in your speaking ability. The only bad things about the class were the excessive grade hits for going over or under time (3 points for every 10 seconds), and the quizzes were just true or false questions on verbatim sentences from the textbook that made it necessary to have the textbook (but not to read it). Please just find the textbook on libgen, its the wrong edition but it has all the same content and still works fine for the quizzes. Overall, stop being so stuck up about your GPA and just take his class to actually get good at presenting and talking to people, it WILL help you get connections and network far more than a 0.1 point higher GPA would.

Professor Wu is an extremely outstanding and caring professor. Coming from a cs major, her workload is incredibly manageable. Her grading is very lax, since I remember completely going over the time limit once yet still getting a 98+

If you want a guaranteed easy communications class I would recommend taking hers.
Such a good teacher! I really learned a lot in this class without having too put in an unreasonable amount of work. She was an easy grader and her assignments never took long. Highly recommend!

Dr. McCloskey is fantastic! He is engaging, and understands that most of his class does not want to worry about an oral communication credit. So, his quizzes are early in the semester, graded work is returned very quickly, and he gives great feedback on the speeches.

What I like most about Thomas is how he works his personal experience into teaching the class. He talks about when he coached debate teams, volunteered in Ukraine as part of the Peace Corps, and his research on the FSU and Ukrainian Nationalism. He is also a really engaging lecturer. My class was 75 minutes long, but he would let us out at least 30 minutes early to work on assignments.

The class consisted of an informative speech, a persuasive speech, a group speech, and a recorded special occasion speech. He provided resources and guidance which made actually giving the speeches easy.

If you have any nerves about public speaking, Thomas is the teacher you want. He is great!

The best professor. So nice, friendly, and understanding. She is always there to help with work or just to talk. She is an easy grader and the assignments were all light work. She taught the lessons well and made them interesting. She truly wants everyone to succeed. If you can take the class with her I 100$ recommend.
Awesome, nice, welcoming, and a fair grader.

I have no idea why the other two reviews are so low. I am literally a stutterer and everyone in my class literally got decent grades on their presentations. She is so understanding and literally says that she has no intention of being a jerk and on the first day she literally told us that this should not be a class that we are stressed out about. The presentations are literally so easy and she lets us do it on anything and I mean anything. Like I got to do a presentation on marvel comics and this one guy did it on why the earth is flat. Super chill and funny. Please take her if you want to actually learn and get an easy A
The BEST PROFESSOR she's super friendly, an easy grader, and makes the class very engaging take her if you can!!!

The kindest and most caring instructor I had at UMD, and maybe I ever will have. She is sociable, and clearly wants all of her students to succeed and make them become comfortable with their public speaking skills.

Just a little side note: Alexandra is still new to teaching COMM107, so she may be less experienced than other COMM107 instructors. However, she is incredibly open to feedback from her students and is always willing to improve their class experience. She’ll definitely get better at teaching comm as time goes by.

If you do the assignments with care, and attend class, it shouldn’t be hard at all to get an A; she’s a very lenient grader. She even treated us with some donuts and snacks on the last day :)

He started the class by saying that we were all the same person and that he doesn't have to get to know us because he already knows who we are, since we are all the same, then spends the rest of the class trying to prove that he cares more about us as students than the "average" professor. He is a HARSH grader, he thinks that the standard should be a C, has very obscure grading criteria and treats the outline that you do for the speech like the review of your doctoral thesis. I have a lot of speech experience and I barely got an A in the class, absolutely ridiculous that he is willing to jeopardize your GPA because of his beliefs.
Literally so easy and relatable. Ends class around 30-45 mins early because she cuts through the BS. Very accommodating and makes everyone feel welcome.
Fantastic teacher. Very kind and helpful. Makes a somewhat boring course easy to get through. Just follow the rubric and you will get an A. Also gives helpful feedback.

T just wanted to make sure we were doing the work and putting in the effort. As long as you do the work, there's nothing to worry about! The grading was lenient, and I definitely submitted a few assignments past the deadline (for the online summer course) and he was very understanding and nice about it.
Great teacher, gives feedback, responds to questions quickly and grades generously

Literally the sweetest person in the entire world, her name honestly says it all. The quizzes are super easy and can be done just by following along with the reading, she is such a nice grader and genuinely wants you to do well. Nicest prof ever, take this class 100%; i've never heard of someone having a bad comm prof, however, she goes above and beyond - its worth a schedule change if necessary. take her!

Extremely easy class and the workload was very light. The main thing T is expecting from you is that you show up to class and put in the bare minimum effort required. The class is truly the definition of if you show up you will get an A.

This is his first year teaching so he's still learning. However, he actually grades the speeches harshly compared to the other instructors. He kinda just springs the speeches on us without enough guidance.

I absolutely ADORE her! She is actually the most wonderful and understanding professor you will encounter. She has set off my college experience on a very good note and is a wonderful and understanding teacher.

Coursework wise, there's really not a lot to do. There are weekly quizzes but 10 questions multiple choice and open note. It's all based on the textbook and you can find the answers fairly easy. There are 3 major speeches, informative, persuasive, and group. As long as you give a good effort and try your best and stay within the time limit, you can get an A+. I can not stress how much she will make your COMM107 experience great and if you can take her PLEASE DO!! Even if it's an 8 am it's going to be ok and her class will be worth it!!!!

The nicest person I have ever met. She really cares about her students and is so accomodating. Take this class, it is easy so long as you do the work and Delight is the best. The whole comm department is decent from what I have heard but she really is the best.

She talks about her ex-husband too much and is unnecessarily strict about attendance, and is super inflexible even when you are genuinely sick. She's a fairly strict grader, and due to the nature of the course (COMM 107 in this case) it is also super subjective, and her grading of our speeches fluctuated a lot even with very similar feedback. I'm not sure how good the other professors are for this course as everyone I know has this one, but if there are any other options I'd highly suggest you go for them.

Professor Golden is an amazing guy and really knows how to connect a classroom of strangers. He's funny, engaging, and conversational, to the point where you forget he's a professor. However, he's a pretty harsh grader and treats this class like his baby, but that's also what makes him a good professor. The class requires practically no work outside of class(besides a weekly 2-question quiz), and there aren't any exams, just presentations that weigh a good portion of your grade. As long as you treat this class like any other class you care about, you will be fine.

He's a great teacher and he genuinely cares about the students and the material. You gotta go to class for attendance but you don't really miss anything crazy he doesn't give any out-of-class assignments except reading and you can skim that. He's an extremely understanding guy and if you put the effort in you will be fine and definitely learn a thing or two. He's also very interactive and entertaining and makes an effort to get to know you.

the best comm instructor ever, i literally love her. she's so lenient with grading and she made the classroom an overall safe space. barely any assignments at all, all you really have to do is show up. and presenting was not scary at all, as long as you know what you're talking about.
Great teacher and very helpful. She is flexible with presentation times as long as you have genuine reasons for conflict and let her know early.

Professor Golden is genuinely one of my favorite professors I've ever had. Sure, I'll admit that he is a harder teacher than most of the other COMM107 instructors and that he grades more rigorously. BUT, every class period is a blast with him and it's always a good time to joke around with him. He loves the students that play off of his humor and interacting with him genuinely puts me in a good mood and sets my day off positively.

Super understanding and lenient with late points, extensions, etc. Will actually give you meaningful feedback and wants you to succeed. Attendance is mandatory but she was very understanding with sick excuses and allowed me to make up all missing participation points. Projects are easy if you put in the time. About 1-2 hours of work per speech, there are 4 speeches. There are very easy weekly homework quizzes, participation points, and reflections to help boost your grade. Would highly recommend to anyone taking COMM107 who wants a bearable experience.

Professor Kim is a very lenient and understanding grader. When it comes to the presentations, even if you slip up, have your awkward moments, or end it abruptly, you will walk out of the class with your grade already entered and it being a lot higher than you expected. You also have plenty of time to complete your outlines and visual aids. There are chapter quizzes based on a textbook, but they only last half-way into the semester and you can do them any time before the due date.

I don't consider myself an extrovert or a good public speaker, but Professor Kim made public speaking (which would normally be my nightmare) into a simple and easy class.

If you can choose your Comm prof PLEASE TAKE RHODES! I think he is leaving soon since he's a grad student but he is absolutely the best prof for comm. He never grades bellow a B as long as you stand up and speak. There are 3 speeches (one group) that make up most of your grade. He took a while to grade my class due to some stuff with his own schooling but he's really great. Class is never mandatory but he will sometimes say something in class just to prove who hasn't been going. The quizes are all based on the textbook which you can find online for free. He's honestly such a vibe 10/10 recommend his class!
Professor Pope is great and I loved how our class bonded. She can get a little frustrated sometimes, but I like this class and she is a great teacher.
Pretty boring and dry, very strict on attendance which hurts with flexibility if you have other events, nothing too spectacular

She is so nice! Her lectures are boring but she knows what shes doing. Honestly, I feel like this course itself is a waste of time, and if you plan on taking it I would take it in the winter. However, if you take it with anyone I would recommend her! She is very lenient on grading presentations, and as long as you email her beforehand with a reasonable explanation, she will take late work as well. The workload for her course is very reasonable. Very very nice lady, I would recommend!

All the quizzes are online which is great and they're pretty straightforward. It's easy to get an A in her class if you just follow the directions in her rubrics for the presentations. My class got close because she always had us do activities do get comfortable with each other. Not a difficult class to take.

Elizabeth Phipps is probably the best comm107 professor there is. We had 9 asynchronous days where we didn't have to go into class at all, and we could just work on our speeches. She also ends class early a lot if she has nothing else to talk about. She also lets you use a device during your speeches, so you can just read off your notes (occasionally looking up or you'll lose points) so you only need to practice your speech a few times. She also gives actually helpful advice on your speeches and doesn't grade them harshly at all. Her quizzes are also super easy as it's open note and the questions aren't hard. 

Overall, a very easy and chill class (in the times when she actually holds a class).
Amazing professor. Super easy grader everything is basically 100%, an easy class, and she is just the nicest human being.

Mashanda is the best professor you can have for comm, hands down. he just wants everyone to pass the class, and if you show up to every class, put in some effort on all assignments, you will get an A easily. super understanding and supportive, and will help you with anything you need.

Very easy course with a very lenient and kind professor. She's understanding of the students and what they want and will help with any assignment there is. Just attend class for participation and it is probably more difficult to get a bad grade in her class than to get a good one. 100% recommend for people who are taking COMM107. Also most of her presentation outlines will probably be graded as a 100% if u just follow her format and the quizzes and participation are easy too.

Great teacher, she cares a lot about her students and makes everyone comfortable with presenting and communications even if its not your strong suit. As long as you submit the work and show up for class it is a very easy A and a great community to be in!!!
Very easy class and Mrs. Munoz is a super nice professor!

Best communications teacher for this fall semester from what I heard from others. Minimal reading, just read the instructions and submit assignments on time and you should be set with an A. He's a nice guy and that shows when he is grading speeches. He is also a professor that encourages to turn in assignments early for feedback and actually does point out what to improve in a reasonable amount of time. Overall good professor.

Professor Delight had to leave mid-semester for maternity leave. However, the time that I did spend with Delight was sure a delight (LOLOL). Jokes aside, she was an amazing professor with an inquisitive and positive energy about her. Her presence would have a ripple effect on the students and thus allow us to work more efficiently. This class was an easy A, and I would highly recommend her as a professor to take and would keep in touch with her over the semesters.

Pros: he allows multiple submissions (before the deadline) and provides feedback quickly, giving opportunities to improve grades and quality of submissions. He also responds quickly over email. 

Cons: He uses A LOT of bad words during class. Poor language is offensive to many and quite unprofessional for a university teacher.

While Golden's grading can be a bit stricter than other professors, he is kind and really teaches you how to be a better presenter. If you're looking for an easy gen-ed class, he may not be for you, but if you don't mind putting in a little work, I'd say its worth it. He is also a bit of a character, which I enjoyed, but may not be everyone's cup of tea.

Professor Fraser has got to be one of the best professors at UMD. She made class super interesting and fun, even though it was at 8 am; you can tell she is passionate about the subject. She is super accommodating and she grades extremely fair. She gives time to complete assignments in class and sometimes we have asynchronous class to complete assignments, which I thought was great. Hands down the best comm107 professor and I definitely recommend her!

Professor T was a great professor. If you show up and put it in an effort, it is an easy A. If you need an extension make sure to email him earlier rather than later. He can be passive aggressive at times but overall he is very funny and a great teacher. He grades very leniently, so as long as you put an effort in on your presentations, you should get an A. The quizzes are quite easy and he lets you take them at home. By the first month he learns everyone in the classes name and he truly cares about his students. I truly recommend him.

Mr. Leach is super nice and funny. I totally recommend this class. There is a weekly quiz (online & open-book), but it is super easy and based off of the textbook. He does make us do some unexpected 30-45 second class presentations (some impromptu, some not), but that only happened like 3 or 4 times over the semester and were super helpful actually, so no biggy. He gave us plenty of time to prepare for presentations, and gave great feedback. Overall, would recommend for a stress free COMM class.

A wonderful teacher who brought good energy into the classroom. I enjoyed the group project the most, she got me to engage with the material even if it wasn't something I was particularly interested in. She knew all the material very well. The slides were very concise. Quizzes were super easy. She never wasted class time and I believe was very fair when grading our presentations. Would definitely recommend her for Comm 107.

Misa was an okay professor. She was sweet don't get me wrong, but she didn't communicate with us well. I think sometimes it was hard to understand directions and what she wanted us to do because English isn't her first language. While the assignments were generally easy and self-explanatory, she would get nit-picky about certain things she wanted to see on our speech outlines- though she previously didn't explain specifics because there were directions to follow. Something nice about her was that instead of having an in-person class every time, she'd do an optional Zoom session if we had questions so we wouldn't have to go in at 8 am. Overall, this class was not hard because all you have to do is give presentations.

If possible don't take this professor. She is okay and grades justly but the way she handles class time is not the best, but she is very late with submitting grades. Most classes are boring. She does a poor job in managing her time and most time she is out of topics to teach/discuss so she covers assignments for the next 2-3 weeks. 
It is easy to get an A if you do your work on time and clearly, but the classes are not enjoyable so if you actually want to learn something in COMM107 don't get this professor.

Overall I found this class to be helpful and fun. Professor Pope was very a great professor who helped push everyone to step outside their comfort zone and try new things. She wasn't very supportive when choosing topics to speak about but she did give good feedback on outlines and the speeches that I gave.

Amazing Teacher! You have to put in some work with your speeches but she wants you to succeed. She is very flexible with submission dates if you let her know ahead of time. If you put in the work, the class should be an easy A.

Great guy, terrible teacher. He's generally a nice guy and there was a really positive environment in the classroom, but I didn't learn anything really. He jokes around a lot, and he makes an effort to get to know all the students. I actually enjoyed showing up to class. But in terms of the coursework, it was basically the opposite. He grades pretty harshly, and the 'lectures' he gives in class aren't super helpful. Communication was (ironically) pretty poor, to the point where I was told that I would be presenting in the middle of class on a particular day, but I was actually presenting first on that day, and wasn't mentally prepared for it. You'll need to practice quite a bit for an A, but if you're fine with a B you can get away without much practice.
Best professor! Super understanding and considerate makes class interesting!

To me, a five-star review is when a professor genuinely cares about their students' success and tries to make them better at whatever is being taught, and this is exactly how Professor Golden is. Its true that his Comm class is more difficult than the others, but there is a reason for this. Its not because he is unfair, but rather because he wants you to put in the work and become better at public speaking. If you put in the effort, you will get a good grade and also gain very useful public speaking skills. Professor Golden is funny and keeps class interesting, and although he can be a little sassy sometimes, I really enjoyed having him as a professor.
Very nice and light grader.
Not worth

Pros:
-Entertaining lectures, can sometimes still do other things during class if you need to 
-Gives good feedback 
-Homework is quick and fairly easy
-Pretty easy A, I felt my work was not always my best, but I still did not get below a 93 on any major assignments.
Cons:
-Homework feels like busywork at times and testbank quizzes felt like they were testing technicalities, rather than major concepts
-You cannot find this textbook online anywhere; you just have to pay the money.
-Sometimes it felt like no matter what I did, I would always do 'something wrong', which maybe says something about the class expectations. I question if it is even possible to get an A+ in this class given some of the critiques I was receiving on outlines and such.

I'd say she deserves like a 4.5/5, but this site does not have that feature, so I'll round up :)

Not sure why she gets a bad rep on here and RateMyProfessor, because she is a very nice and caring professor who wants people to succeed. She grades speeches and outlines lightly according to the rubric, so just follow the points and you'll do fine. She does a lot of activities to make the class fun and get people over their fears of public speaking. While these activities are annoying and embarrassing at first, they will 100% make you a better speaker. She is somewhat strict about late work, but if you have a good excuse you can often receive less of a penalty. Quizzes are online and super easy (the questions are straight out of the textbook). The only real work for this class is preparing for speeches, but she gives you outline templates for all of them that makes them a lot less work. Overall, a great professor.
She was an amazing professor!!! An easy grader and her assignments were fair. Highly recommend!

Such an easy class and gened with her. Comm is just an annoying class to take, especially if you don't like public speaking, but Munoz was such an easy grader and honestly was so considerate to everyone. Definitely take her if you can!!
Was amazing! Very organized, grades quickly, cares about his students. Take his class for comm 107. If you put in the work and take the quizzes the first week of class you are all set!
Gerry is amazing. As long as you show effort, she will love you.

Professor Golden is very nice and if you want to truly learn about communicating and interview skills he's your guy. However if you're just looking for an easy gen ed and thinking this will be a gpa booster you better think again. He's very strict about how the presentations are done and because of his experience notices even the small mistakes and believe me he WILL take points off for them. Just try to stay within the time limit (something I struggled with but that's my fault) because 3 points are taken off for every 10 seconds over time which can add up and talk to him after or before class and get to know him because he is a cool guy.

Super chill guy and a super easy grader. I would definitely take him for comm107. Easiest A so far in college and the class is pretty enjoyable. he doesn't expect too much and there are only 3 main presentations and one of them is a group presentation.

She gives you a lot of advice and feedback on the speeches you give during the semester, and she's pretty lenient on the grading. She lets you use a device during your speech so you never really need to make notecards for your speech, and you don't really need to memorize it. The best thing about he is she gives you a BUNCH of asynchronous days where you don't have to go into class and she just lets you work on your speech. On days where she does have class she usually just lets you go 30 minutes early because she has nothing left to talk about. She's very little nonsense so she gets straight to the point in class and you can just leave (she does make you go in on some days, but the asynchronous days make up for it). Overall she's a very nice lady, and it's a pretty easy A if you put a tiny bit of effort into it. 

Overall, if you're looking for an easy A for your comm gen ed just take her, and you most definitely will not regret it. :)
Since most gened professor are good, so why not choose a professor who’s more generous?
The lecture of the professor is boring. Literally I didn't learn anything and the grade is also srtict.

she’s a really nice professor and definitely a fair grader. lectures are a bit boring but that’s not really on her since it's based on things you’ve already read in the textbook. her reading quizzes are also super easy and open note, so it's an almost guaranteed 9/10 or 10/10 on those. you’ll have 4 presentations throughout the year (informative, persuasive, small group, and a special occasion), and as long as you take them relatively seriously you should pass with a good grade in the class.

Great teacher, as someone who was just taking the class as a gen ed I was suprised to find myself excited to go to class every lecture. She was always willing to discuss if you missed a question on a quiz and always gave feedback if you made a mistake during a presentation. Always very fair when it came to grading and truly wants you to succeed in the class. Overall great professor and I could not recommend her enough, if you get the chance to take her class please do!

Honestly, the best professor I had this past semester. You can tell she truly cares about you and your overall development within public speaking. HIGHLY RECOMMEND PROFESSOR BAILEY. If you put in the work to improve she will reciprocate.

Very nice professor that wants to see her students succeed. She is very flexible with due dates and when you plan on presenting. Makes the classroom a comfortable environment for everyone to present in.

I can not express how truly amazing Dr. McCloskey is. I am a pretty apprehensive public speaker, however, he was so supportive and really just wanted to see you succeed. He allows you to resubmit your work as many times as you want before the due date, to get back credit on points you may have lost. For speeches, he gives you outlines to follow, so if you follow them, literally word for word, you will get full credit. There are like ten quizzes you have to do and they are open textbooks and are super easy -- you can do them way ahead of time to get them out of the way. He gives great feedback on your speeches and responds to emails very quickly. He's also really funny and is so passionate about making things relatable and will often use little anecdotes about his children which is endearing. This is an hour and fifteen-minute class, but he would often let us go maybe 20-30 minutes into class, just because we'd be done with what we needed to get done in the day. If you're going to take COMM107, definitely choose Dr. McCloskey!!

Gerry is a very easy going and supportive teacher. That being said, her grading is very random and varied based off how much she likes the topic and student. She goes on lots of tangents and gets off track a TON. If you’re not a natural public speaker, it will be a challenging, but very helpful class. I ended with 899/1000 points and she refused to give me one extra point, so I ended with a B+, which was very disappointing. Overall very easy and manageable class, so it was unfortunate to end with a B.

The class can be quite mundane at times as it goes through a lot of the theoretical nature of presentations, but overall Professor Zhang grades quite leniently (given I have really bad speech anxiety) and is very constructive with her feedback. Quizzes were quite easy (2 attempts and open notes based on the textbook). Overall, I had a great experience with her.

I had 8AM comm with her which was bound to suck but she was such a good professor! Really honest about her own anxieties with public speaking, making it easier for us to speak. She's fun, reasonable, and considerate; class was always lively, I could email her and let her know if I was going to turn in something late (i never got any points off) and she understood our needs and gave us plenty of asynchronous class days during a particularly hard semester. I'm going to miss her!

HE IS THE GOAT. The class is engaging and he seems very passionate about what he teaches. He literally even said in the beginning of the semester that he doesn't want us to be stressed about his class, and that he will accommodate us if need be. The presentations topics are basically 100% up to us. HIGHLY recommend you take him!

Taylor is such a great instructor and she cares so much about her students! She really wants all of her students to improve and feel more comfortable with public speaking by the end of the semester. She also grades very fairly so if you do all of the work, you will do well.

Awesome choice for COMM 107! He is a super easy grader and it requires very low effort to get a high A in his class (I think I've only lost 1 point out of 1,000 the whole semester). However, he does struggle sometimes with clarity and making it known what assignments to do and when they are due, so make sure to ask questions and check ELMS regularly. However, overall a very solid choice.

Best Best Best Professor you could have for this (necessary but unnecessary gen-ed). She understand that this is a gen-ed course and that a lot of people are not enthusiastic about taking this class like at all but she  made it worthwhile by curating an open space where students would feel comfortable presenting in a smedium crowd. There are 3 individual speeches (Informative, Persuasive, and Special Occasion) and 1 group speech. You will have to submit an outline for every single speech and that should be a breeze since she only requires minimum guidelines on how you need to structure your outline. She does allow any type of notecards or phones (whatever you need to help your speech). She does grade a little more "harsher" but it's doable if you actually improve on the thing that she mentions because she leaves very detailed feedback. But like I said, her grading can seem little out of tune with her feedback she gives, but honestly don't sweat it too much. You should pass with an A regardless.

Dan was a great teacher, seems to have an interest in the students and nice class environment. While his grading was harder than other professors, his class is relatively easy to do well in, with him giving good feedback and constructive points. He was overall a solid professor who I would take again.

Professor Pope is a must-take. She explains what is expected clearly and is a lovely grader as long as you do your best! All she wants to see is improvement. If you've struggled in public speaking before, she makes a friendly environment where you can grow your skills.

Sean is a great teacher, especially for COMM107. He really creates a welcoming and safe environment which can be important as the class can be daunting to some. Grading wise, he is A VERY SLOW grader but very lenient (literally never actually graded any presentations just put a final grade into testudo even though he continuously said the grades would be inputted into canvas soon). I would highly recommend him as a professor as he understands that most don't want to take the class but are instead required to which makes him lenient to grading as long as you are actively participating in the class consistently.

She is a great comm professor who can connect to the students very well since she is young and understanding. She teaches the material very well and has helpful critiques to help you improve. She sometimes takes a long time to grade assignments and answer emails, but you can just follow up with her or speak to her in person, and she helps right away.

Amazing Teacher, she cares about her students a lot. You have to put a lot of time for planning and writing speeches, but I feel that you're given enough time. The professor also makes it easy to go in the front of the class when you have to present. She is also very understanding and provides in depth feedback after you present. Overall a very helpful teacher that is very approachable
Loved her! 107 was so easy compared to other instructors, no exams, weekly online quizzes are open book, attendance isn't mandatory. Honestly a really sweet professor

He is a super easy grader and generally very chill, however he is not the best with due dates and using ELMS in general so make sure to check in with him during class and clarify what he wants submitted and when. Overall he is nice, a good choice for COMM107 and makes it an easy A if you put in any effort.
She was always energetic and super sweet. I can feel she wants her students to succeed in this class and I did improve my public speaking!

Professor Park is super sweet and passionate about teaching! She cares about her students and gives very helpful feedback throughout the semester. I liked how she instructed us and it really helped me to improve my public speaking.

She ate. Funny, wants to see you succeed. I was always super nervous to present which messed up my presentations a bit, but I still always got an A. Even though she was an easy grader she gave great feedback for future presentations. If you can take Ran take her!

Professor Park was one of my favorite professors this semester with a strong commitment to her students' learning and success. Her lectures were well-structured, engaging, and informative. She consistently encouraged active participation and fostered an inclusive and respectful classroom environment. She provided constructive feedback on assignments, which greatly helped me to be better. It was an 8am morning class, but she was always energetic and tried to bring more fresh energy to the class.

Absolutely incredible professor and highly recommend!! Thomas grades assignments quickly in less than 24 hours, gives you your presentation grade right when you finish your presentation, offers great feedback, and is very organized - he lets the class out around half an hour - 45 min in advance to work on the weekly quizzes or independent work for the next speech and trusts us to finish the busy work elsewhere instead of taking up the full hour and fifteen minutes. Lecture wise, I genuinely enjoyed them and the course was fun with Thomas teaching and is very knowledgeable and very chill. Put in the work, take his feedback, and you will get an A.

Great professor loved her. Creates a super comfortable, chill environment that makes public speaking a lot easier. Gives really good feedback on speeches. A lot of classes were asynchronous which was super nice, and on days that we did go in class ended early most of the time. Also the quizzes are open book so they're super easy. Definitely would recommend!

love dr mccloskey!! he is super understanding of any extensions u may need and after talking to other friends taking comm107 he seems to be the easiest professor. grades everything super leniently and doesn't expect super high quality work

She's awesome to have for COMM107 -- Professor Kaufer is kind, organized, and very approachable. She is well aware that this class is one everyone has to take, but few are truly interested in, so she's not nitpicky or overly serious like some profs. The major assignments are 3 presentations, which are graded fairly, and she does her best to minimize any pressure/anxiety people have and offer insightful feedback.

Overall, she really does want the best for you, and I'd say people leave her class as noticeably better presentational speakers.

I really adored Instructor Savchuk even though my COMM107 class was asynchronous. She was super, super sweet and helpful. You could tell that she cared that her students did well. She gave tons of informative feedback on assignments. You could tell she took a lot of time working on the feedback. If you emailed her she would respond right away. She was super helpful. She is super super good and would recommend her 100%

I had Professor Doherty as a sub for the past few weeks of the fall semester. Since the last professor was new and not great, I was hoping Doherty would make the last few weeks worthy of a communications class. I'm not sure why she gets a bad rep here, considering she was a decent professor. Yes, she sometimes did talk about other stuff (like her ex-husband, lol), but I think she does that to connect with the class a little more and alleviate the tension of a new professor a bit. Everyone likes a professor with even a small sense of humor. However, as a professor, she spoke clearly, and at least for me, I could tell she was a decent communications professor. She even discussed one-on-one at selected times during class with different groups on their outlines and presentation slides. 
With only a few weeks left, she graded our last two presentations with leniency and gave constructive feedback. She did say she graded her own students harder, but overall, I think she has higher expectations. Overall, the last weeks went smoothly.

Straight to the point, a very clear and transparent professor overall. Given that I had her during 8ams and she commutes from Virginia, about 40% of the days we'd normally have her were purposely scheduled to instead be office hours for anyone who wanted to meet one-on-one over Zoom. Out of all 4 speeches in this class, two of them were individual, one of them was with a group, and the final was an online video submission that would be no more than 2-3 minutes long. If one of your group members ends up not showing up, she will be very understanding of this and reflect it in her grading and feedback. Her feedback, to add to that, is succinct, appearing to give genuinely thoughtful critiques and remarks on your strengths. 

Moreover, I'll mention that going into this I was admittedly anxious about public speaking, but it quickly became clear with Phipps that not only does she keep this in mind, but also seems to facilitate a class environment/atmosphere of sorts that makes you feel more natural.

Take her if you can!
she's super chill. take her if u can, comms will be the easiest a uve ever gotten

I enjoyed my experience in COMM107 with Viktoriia. I would recommend taking this course in the async format during the winter term like I did. It's a good way to knock out a gen-ed and fulfill 3 credits during the long academic break. It was only 3 weeks long and the work load was pretty light. Generally there was one assignment per day. Some required more effort like a recorded speech (four in total) but most did not take long to complete. Viktoriia was very kind, she sent reminders for assignments and was very approachable. Her feedback on assignments was thorough and constructive and the grading was not too strict. Everyone has to take this course or an equivalent, so I would recommend taking COMM107 with Viktoriia!

For 107, you really only learn the basics of presenting and you might already know most of that stuff, so class isn't that helpful other than days she explains projects. We had quite a few presentations but it does make  you better at presenting and getting over any fears you may have. She's a pretty easy grader as long as you hit all the general points. Class usually ended a half hour early unless it was a full presentation day. Her quizzes were easy and straight forward. She definitely doesn't make the course herself, so sometimes there's errors in the she shows but nothing that really inhibits your grade. The presentations topics are so vague, honestly really loved the class and loved having her as a professor. If you had questions or actually really wanted help to get better, she def would.
Would recommend taking her for 107. NO EXAMS, ONLY FINAL PROJECT. PRETTY EASY A
